The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio has been selling livestock for the past 18½ years, with a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings. Nicasio is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying his first loan successfully.  

Nicasio will use the loan to purchase more goats, cows and sheep for sale. He will plough the anticipated profit back into the business. 

His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land to build a residential house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more goats, cows and sheep for selling.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 27 years old. He has spent five years in farming. He wants this Kiva loan to buy quality seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow, which will provide fertilizer from its waste, and milk for the entire family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for labor during rice production

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 23 years old and single. He has spent five years in rice farming. 

With the loan from Kiva, Jean Baptiste wants to buy quality seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to expand his plot for rice growing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 50 años de edad habita junto a su esposo y su hijo en casa propia es una mujer muy trabajadora, toda su vida se ha dedicado hacer una mujer ejemplar para su familia, muy responsable con sus qué haceres del hogar y de la mano de su esposo ayudan para que nunca les falte el pan de cada día. Virginia se dedica a la labor de ser agricultora de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y sorgo, Siempre cada mañana se levanta con nuevos deseos de superación y emprende su día de labores cosechando y luego recolectando para vender cierta parte y otra dejarla para consumos propio. Ella desea comprar insumos agrícolas para estas nuevas cosechas próximas es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas u otros. Así ella podrá seguir brindando una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Virginia, 50, lives together with her husband and her son in her own house. She is a very hard-working woman. All her life, she has worked to be an exemplary woman for her family. She is very responsible with her household duties, and together with her husband, she has made sure that they never lacked their daily bread. Virginia works farming basic grains like corn, beans, and sorghum. Every morning, she wakes up with the desire to improve and she starts her work day harvesting and then gathering to sell part of it and set part of it aside for their own consumption. She wants to buy farming supplies for the next harvest. This is why she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and more. This way, she will be able to continue providing her family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and more.

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
Luis Javier de 27 años de edad, se ha caracterizado en su vereda por ser un hombre comprometido con su trabajo. Dedicado desde su infancia a las labores agropecuarias y ganaderas, debido a la tradición familiar. 
En la actualidad se ha dedicado a la ganadería, actividad que le permite generar recursos para el sostenimiento de sus padres, quienes se encuentran en una edad avanzada y en condiciones delicadas de salud.
Diariamente se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para iniciar su faena y culmina con sus labores a las cuatro de la tarde. 
Asegura que el campo ha sido y será su mejor hogar. Agradece a sus padres por todo lo que le han ofrecido y considera que la mejor retribución que puede ofrecerles es su amor. 
Sueña con incrementar el número de reses para mejorar la lechería y generar mayores ingresos, con los cuales pueda garantizarles a sus padres una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que espera financiar la compra del ganado ya que no cuenta con recursos propios para dicha inversión.
texts.en: Luis Javier, 27, is a man committed to his work. He has worked in agriculture and ranching since his childhood, because of family tradition. Currently, he works in ranching, work which lets him generate income to support his parents, who are elderly and in delicate health. Every day, he gets up at four in the morning to start work and he finishes up at four in the afternoon. He says that the fields have been and will be his best home. He is grateful to his parents for all they have given him and thinks that the best repayment he can offer is his love. He dreams of having more livestock to improve the dairy and earn more income, with which he can guarantee his parents an old age without financial concerns. This is why he is asking for a loan, which he hopes will finance the purchase of livestock, since he doesn't have his own resources for this investment.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Luz Edilma

texts.es:
Luz Edilma de 54 años de edad, ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a laborar, desde muy temprana edad debió garantizar el sustento para ella y su familia debido a las condiciones económicas de su hogar. 
Su vida no ha sido color de rosa, debido a que contrajo nupcias y su relación no fue lo que imaginó. Después de 20 años de casada y con  6 hijos, su esposo la abandonó. Por lo cual le tocó asumir las responsabilidades del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante Luz ha logrado superar las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida.
Hoy cuenta con una tienda en la que comercializa productos de  la canasta familiar y la cual se ha convertido en el sustento para su familia. Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos.

Su mayor sueño es garantizar que sus dos hijos menores de edad puedan acceder a una educación de calidad y gozar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Luz Edilma, 54, has dedicated a large part of her life to working. From an early age, she had to support herself and her family due to the economic conditions in the home. Her life has not been rosy, because she got married and it was not what she had imagined. After 20 years of marriage and six children, her husband abandoned her, so she had to assume responsibility for the household. Thanks to her effort and will to move forward, Luz has been able to overcome the adversities that life has presented her. Today she has a store in which she sells basic household goods and it has become the means of supporting her family. She is seeking a loan that she will invest in buying merchandise to increase her sales and earn more income. Her greatest dream is to make sure that her two minor children can get a quality education and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic household goods

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 28 years old, married, and a mother of one child. For the past two years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. Halima earns a monthly income of KES 6,550 from the business. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000, to buy additional stock, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions, to resell to her customers at her kiosk. 

Halima will use the profits made possible by this loan, to pay for her child's school fees and to expand the business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business, so that she may uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more produce, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions, to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old. He wants this Kiva loan to buy quality seeds and fertilizers, and to pay labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help him to expand his rice production. He has successfully repaid the first loan, and he is now requesting another after realizing the boom of his production. His cultivated land yielded more tons of rice with the help of the first loan, which has enabled him to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers, and to pay labor costs during rice production

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena de 57 años de edad, es una mujer que lucha por mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar. Es separada desde hace más de 15 años, por lo cual debe generar el sustento para su familia, ya que su cónyuge no asumió ninguna responsabilidad. 
Inicio su negocio comercializando productos de la  canasta  familiar gracias al capital que le regaló uno de sus hijos. Magdalena agradece inmensamente a Dios por que a pesar de las situaciones difíciles por las que tuvo que atravesar, logró sacar adelante a sus  seis hijos, quienes hoy son su mayor apoyo.

Diariamente labora de siete de la mañana a diez de la noche, con la ayuda de una nuera, mientras realiza las labores en su casa.
Con el propósito de aumentar inventarios y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos, Magdalena se encuentra solicitando un crédito. 
Espera que esta inversión genere una mayor rentabilidad con la que pueda mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 57 years old, and has worked extremely hard her whole life to provide for her family. She has been separated from her ex-husband for over 15 years, and her job is the sole source of income for her household.

Magdalena opened her small business with some startup capital that one of her children gave her, and she still operates her general store. She is grateful to God for the strength He has given her to raise and provide for her six children and get through challenging situations.

Every day, Magdalena works from 7:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. One of her daughters-in-law helps her in the store and with some of the household chores. In hopes of increasing her inventory and offering clients a wider variety of products, Magdalena is requesting this loan. She plans to use the support from the loan to purchase products to stock her general store. She hopes that this investment will help her to generate more business and profits, and will in turn improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase products for daily use to stock her general store.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín de 47 años de edad, es un guerrero que tiene claro que busca en la vida y como lograr sus objetivos. Asegura que lo más importante es su familia y que cualquier esfuerzo vale la pena, si a cambio recibe el amor de su hogar. 
Martín se dedica desde hace 10 años a la comercialización de prendas de vestir y calzado, mercancía que vende no sólo en el centro de la Ciudad si no que recorre los diferentes municipios del departamento a fin de abrir nuevos mercados y mejorar sus ingresos.
Una de sus mayores dificultades es lidiar con la condición climática que afecta notablemente sus ventas.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un local para comercializar su mercancía y poder compartir más tiempo con su familia. Pero tiene claro que este será un proyecto a mediano plazo. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido para responder a los pedidos que le han solicitado y generar mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Martin is 47 years old. He is a warrior who knows how to look at life and achieve his goals. He makes sure that the most important thing is his family and whatever it takes is worth it, if in exchange he receives the love of his family.

Martín has been working for ten years selling clothing and shoes. He sells his merchandise not only in the city center but travels to various municipalities in the department in order to establish new markets and improve his income.

One of his biggest challenges is contending with the weather that considerably affects his sales.

His biggest dream is to be able to have his own facility to sell his merchandise and to be able to share more time with his family. But he realizes that this is a medium term project. Currently he is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies in able to fulfill orders placed and to generate higher profits that will permit a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell in his business.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is 42 years old. She is married and lives in the small town of Telavi, with her spouse and 20-year-old daughter. Vera’s husband works as a security guard and earns a small monthly salary.  The main income for Vera is her grocery store located in the suburb of Telavi, selling different kinds of groceries. The store has been profitable project, but it needs more support (capital) to further develop. Several times she has asked for loans from local financial institutions to develop her business, but without success. Her loan requests were rejected each time, because of her low income.

Vera’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, called the Start-up Loan Program. This program provides credit for business start-ups and restart-ups, with soft conditions, to the rural poor who do not have access to ordinary credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the received credit, Vera will cover the costs of purchasing more inventory, of basic groceries that customers often request. She has already rented a new commercial space, which has a better location. She plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Start-up Loan from Kiva, will significantly increase the income of the family. Vera will work hard, and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. With this loan, her family will generate enough income to access regularly-available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need to.

loans.use: to buy more basic groceries for resale in her grocery store, which she has moved to a better location

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cables, lightbulbs, paint, and other items.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 30-year-old businessman. He is married to Eva, and together they have been blessed with one child. He has been operating a motorcycle transportation business for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Benson is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD, after having repaid the previous loans successfully. He will use the new loan to purchase spare parts for repairing his motorcycle. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable, and able to cater to his family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Lidivine

texts.en:
Lidivine, aged 37 years, is married and has three children. With the loan, she wants to buy quality seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs during rice production. Lidivine plans to use the profits for renovating her family's house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old. Her husband's name is Nelson, and they have four children, aged 18, 16, 14, and 9. For the past year, she has been running a retail shop with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. She also sells shoes to supplement her income. She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying her earlier loan successfully. 

Mary will use this loan to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, sweets, green grams (lentils), and other supplies for her retail shop. She intends to plough back the income earned from her business and start investing for her children’s future.

Her hopes and dreams are to open her own wholesale shop and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, sweets, and green grams (lentils).

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 67 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children. Merlita has a dress-making business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month with this business. She has requested a loan to buy additional cloth, thread, and other accessories for her business. Merlita has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cloth, thread, and other accessories.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 63 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has two children. Editha has a fish-selling business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month with this work. She has requested a loan to buy more fish to sell. Editha has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ovidio De Jesús

texts.es:
Ovidio  de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y calzado en la ciudad de Medellín, Colombia desde hace tres años. Esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos con la cual sostiene a sus dos hijos y esposa. 
Debido a una crisis económica familiar, optó por dedicarse a la venta de mercancía. Se encuentra gratamente satisfecho con su actividad porque asegura que sus condiciones económicas han mejorado y puede ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena educación.
Ovidio es un hombre lleno de retos en la vida, pero lo que más sorprende a sus vecinos es la disciplina con la que traza su camino. “no soy de los que se rinden, porque considero que los imposibles no son más que ilusiones que el ser humano se crea en su mente” con esta frase Ovidio describe su personalidad. Asegura que gracias a su perseverancia ha podido llegar a montar su negocio. 
Aunque la tarea no es nada fácil y la competencia se torna agresiva, se enfrenta a los retos con valentía y siempre con la convicción de la obtener la victoria.  Con sus ideales claros y con granas de triunfar, Ovidio se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía y dos vitrinas a fin de adecuar sus productos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ovidio is 47 years old and makes a living selling clothing and shoes in the city of Medellín, Colombia. He has been working in this area for three years, and this job is the sole source of income for himself, his wife and their two children.

As a result of a family crisis, Ovidio decided to start a small retail business. He feels grateful and satisfied with his work as it has enabled him to improve his family's financial condition and provide a good education for his children.

Ovidio has faced many challenges in life, but he has always viewed those tough times with the same attitude: "I am not someone who gives up, because the impossible is just an illusion, a creation of the human mind. Everything is possible." Ovidio has lived his life by this motto and vision, and thanks to his perseverance, he has been able to launch his business.

Although the work has never been easy and the competition in his industry is stiff, Ovidio always faces the obstacles in his path with courage and conviction. With his goals and values in mind, Ovidio is requesting this loan to help him purchase clothing and shoes to stock his business. He also plans to purchase two showcase cabinets for displaying his merchandise. He hopes that his investment will sharpen his business model and increase his overall profits and success.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes and two showcase cabinets for displaying his merchandise.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: El socio Raymundo nació en la ciudad de Anta pero  vive en la misma ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía además a la elaboración venta de ladrillos y tejas.  Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como leña.
texts.en: Raymundo was born in the city of Anta, and lives in the same city, in Cusco. He is 37 years old. He has a lifetime relationship from which he has a son. Hardworking and responsible, working in the production of handicraft, and also in the sale of bricks and tiles, he has been doing this work for ten years. It is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. At this time he is asking for a loan to buy work supplies such as firewood.

loans.use: to buy work supplies such as firewood

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en: Cleopatra is 66 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has four children. Cleopatra has a dry goods and dried fish selling business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to buy more dried fish for her retail business. Cleopatra has been a member of PMPC since December 2012. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is 70 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has seven children. Sofia makes pillowcases and curtains and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month this way. She has requested a loan to buy more cloth, thread, and other accessories. Sofia has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Sofia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cloth, thread, and other accessories.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es: Raquel, continúa con su negocio de taxi, siendo el cadete su esposo ambos se ayudan de esa manera para brindarle a sus hijos lo mejor en lo que cabe dentro de sus posibilidades, está muy contenta por los avances obtenidos con los cambios de infraestructura en su hogar, ahora hará la construcción del muro frontal ya que el cerco es de palos y alambre de púa, muy inseguro y peligroso para los niños, con esta inversión asegurara su espacio de vivienda y dará mejor apariencia, necesitara comprar bloques, cemento, piedrines, arena, hierro y pagara la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Raquel continues operating and organizing a taxi business with her husband, who is a taxi driver. Both Raquel and her husband work hard to provide all they can for their children, and Raquel is very content with the improvements they have been able to make to their house and property. 

Rqauel is requesting this loan in order to purchase construction materials for putting up a wall at the front of their property and house. They hope to purchase: blocks, cement, stone, sand, iron rebar and labor costs. The current boundary marker they have in place is a stick and barbed wire fence, which is not safe and is dangerous for children. They hope this investment and building project will improve their living space and the overall appearance of their home.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, rock, sand, iron and labor costs for making home improvements.

loans.name: Reina Yasmin

texts.es: Reina Yasmin vive junto a su compañero de vida Carlos y su hija en casa propia ; ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de zapatos, tiene varios años con el negocio pues su padre le enseño el oficio lo que le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias y al mismo tiempo cada dia mejorar su labor, comercia desde su hogar y en forma ambulante se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Reina es una mujer  activa, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora todos los días se esfuerza por tratar de cumplir sus sueños, sabe que solo con constancia y amor al trabajo podrá alcanzar ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del producto y quiere ponerse a la altura de su competencia por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia cuero, forro, suela, etc. Reina Yasmin tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor con todos los beneficios que se merecen.
texts.en:
Reina Yasmin lives with her life companion, Carlos, and her daughter in her own home. She makes and sells shoes. She has been doing this for several years as her father taught her the business which has given her a lot of experience permitting her to obtain higher profits and while improving her work each day. 

She sells from home and as a street vendor and has made many customers as people prefer her because everything she sells is top quality and at a good price and the service is always unbeatable and to the customers preferences. Reina is an active woman, dedicated to her work and fighting every day putting her efforts into trying to fulfill her dreams. She knows that only with perseverance and love of work can she achieve that success.

In recent weeks the demand has increased for her product and she wants to put herself above the competition and so is asking Integral for a loan to permit her to buy supplies such as leather, linings, soles, etc. Reina Yasmin has good payment references. She is very responsible and is sure she can pay off the loan and at the same time has faith that she will give her family a better life with all the benefits they are worthy of.

loans.use: to buy leather, lining, and soles for the production and sale of shoes

loans.name: Iris Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Iris pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casada, con  32 años de edad,  Profesional, asalariada trabajadora del estado con un ingreso muy bajo, oficinista con un cargo de menor rango. Su núcleo familiar lo conforman su esposo y su niña  que es  menor de edad. 

Ella  comenta  que entre los dos se han apoyado para salir adelante como familia, apoyándose con los estudios y la casa que construyeron. 

Actualmente están aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de  un financiamiento para   instalar un  sistema sanitario económico que consiste en la instalación de un inodoro convencional con la construcción de sistema de tratamiento de efluentes (un tanque y un pozo de absorción), esto lo requiere  ya que por donde ella habita no es posible el acceso a aguas negras, por lo que para su uso la familia cuenta con una  letrina, siendo su familia una de la miles que no tienen acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida  y  también contribuir con el medio ambiente. 

sin la oportunidad de este crédito es imposible que Iris tenga acceso a un inodoro ya que es muy costoso. con su bajo salario es imposible que logre instalar, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias muy pobres.  las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector mas vulnerable.
texts.en:
Doña Iris lives in the town of Niquinohomo, which was selected to participate in a pilot program to improve local training with respect to sanitation issues in Nicaragua. Iris is 32 years old, married, and a salaried professional who works for the state. She earns a very low salary as an entry-level clerk. Her family includes her husband and their young daughter. Iris says that she and her husband help one another in supporting their family, which includes paying for their child’s studies and building their house.

She is currently applying to participate in a water and sanitation project, which includes obtaining a loan for the installation of an affordable sanitation system. This includes the installation of a conventional toilet and a wastewater treatment system (that includes a tank and an absorption well). This setup is required because the place where she lives does not have access to sewer lines. For this reason, her family has been using a latrine. Her family is one of thousands who do not have access to improved sanitation. This project will benefit several municipalities across Nicaragua by providing them a better quality of life and a cleaner environment.

Without the opportunity provided by this loan, it would be impossible for Iris to have a toilet installed since it would be very expensive. The cost would be impossible with her low wages. These types of programs are helping extremely poor families since latrines cause illnesses and contaminate the air. Therefore, it is a good idea that these solutions are being targeted at the most vulnerable populations.

loans.use: to buy materials for installing a toilet and a wastewater treatment system.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La señora Dominga, madre de dos hijos de 8 y 17 años, su esposo se vio obligado a viajar fuera del país en busca de empleo por la situación difícil del país, ella continua con el comercio de cosméticos por catálogos, lo que le ha permitido ir invirtiendo en su vivienda poco a poco, en esta ocasión realizara la construcción del porche, lo que todavía le hace falta en la casa para que sus hijos jueguen en un espacio amplio en su propio hogar, por lo que necesita comprar cemento, arena, bloques, hierro, perlines, laminas de zinc y pagar la mano de obra, esta mejora es posible gracias al apoyo de financiamiento con bajos intereses.
texts.en:
Dominga is the mother of 2 children, ages 8 and 17.  Her husband is obliged to travel outside the country in search of employment due to the difficult situation in his country.  Dominga continues to sell cosmetics from catalogs, which enables her to continue investing in her house, little by little.

On this occasion, she wishes to construct a porch, which the house still lacks, so that her children can play in an ample space within their own home. To do that, she needs to purchase cement, sand, concrete blocks, iron rods, roof supports, and zinc sheets, and to pay the construction workers.

The improvement is possible thanks to this financial help at low interest.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, concrete blocks, iron rods, roof supports, and zinc sheets; and to pay laborers for the construction work.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos vive junto a su nieto de veintidós años en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, leche, pan, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su vivienda en una comunidad muy transitada de personas , ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque es la tienda mas surtida con productos de calidad, a muy buenos precios y además con un servicio excelente; Santos es una mujer emprendedora, activa, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Santos  tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her granddaughter in their own house, and she operates a small grocery store that sells a variety of useful products, including: staple grains, milk, bread, soaps, sweets and other items. Santos has worked at her business for many years, and she has a lot of experience with sales and buying products in bulk that will allow her to generate the best profit margins. Her store is located in her house, which is on a fairly busy street and allows a wide range of customers to pass by the business. Her customers prefer to shop at her store, since she offers a great selection of high quality products at affordable prices and her service is excellent.

Santos is an active, entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to her work and desires to get ahead in life. She is always looking for new opportunities to grow and strengthen her business, a vision that has led her to INTEGRAL and to request this loan. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase staple grains, sweets, canned food, drinks, soaps and other items to stock her store. With good references and a history of prompt repayments, Santos is confident that she can repay this loan. She is grateful for this opportunity and hopes this investment will help her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, sweets, canned food, drinks, soaps and other products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor,37 años de edad, de oficio comerciante , se dedica a vender verduras, frutas y venta de comida en las afuera de su casa, habita en la ciudad de Granada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y el mayor vive independiente. 
Ella trabaja desde muy pequeña junto con su mama en el comercio , desde los 10 años salía a vender frutas y verduras  con su familia, pero tristemente la salud de su madre fue teniendo complicaciones . Así que tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio . Diariamente sus hijas le ayudan con el negocio después de la escuela mientas ella se dedica prepara comida para vender .
Ella anhela poder construir una pequeña caseta donde pueda vender frutas , verduras y comidas en mejores condiciones. 
Está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, salsa de tomate, salsa inglesa, mayonesa, verduras, frutas, carnes y leña. Todo en materia prima para vender comida.
texts.en:
Flor is 37 years old. She is a merchant. She works selling vegetables, fruit and food sales outside her home. She lives in the city of Granada. She has 3 children of which 2 are students and the oldest lives independently.

She has worked since she was very young alongside her mother in the marketplace, for ten years selling fruits and vegetables with her family, but sadly the health of her mother brought complications, so she had to take over the business. Her daughters help her everyday with the business after school while she works preparing food to sell. 

She longs to build a small stand where she can sell fruit, vegetables and food in a better facility.  

She needs this funding to buy rice, oil, sugar, tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, mayonnaise, vegetables, fruit, meat and firewood. All the staples she needs to sell food.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, mayonnaise, vegetables, fruit, meat, and firewood.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old, and a poultry farmer. She is married to Robert, and together they have been blessed with two children. Esther has been practicing poultry farming for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.  

Esther is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase poultry feed, and chicks for rearing. With the anticipated profits from her farm, she will purchase a dairy cow. Her hope and dream is to build rental houses, financed by KADET.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and one-year-old chicks

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone!  Please meet 33-year-old Lamrana, from Calabatown.  She is married and has one child, who is 10 years old and currently attending school. Lamrana has a provisions and drinks business, selling items such as milk, sugar, Ovaltine and mayonnaise.  She started her business in 2008, in order to earn the money to send her child to school. 

She plans to use the loan to buy more inventory for her store.  She hopes to grow her business, so that she can be a wholesaler who sells large quantities.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory, such as milk, sugar, Ovaltine and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es: Ana Bertha  vive junto a su pequeña familia y sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la  venta de productos de salud y de uso personal, los vende por catalogo y posee en variedad acetaminofén, jarabes, desodorante, crema, champu etc., tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; Ana es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar medicinas, cremas, desodorantes, etc. Ana Berta tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confia que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Bertha lives with her small family and her children in their own house, and she makes a living selling personal health and beauty items from a catalog. Her products include: acetaminophen, cough syrups, deodorant, creams, shampoo, etc. She has been working in this industry for many years, and has lots of experience purchasing products in bulk that enable her to generate the best profit margins. Ana Bertha travels around selling her merchandise from a catalog and from her home, and she has worked hard to grow her customer base. Her clients prefer to buy from her because they know they will always get the items and quality they need at affordable prices and with excellent service.

Ana is an entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to her work, and who does not give up easily until she achieves her goals. In recent months, customer demand for her products has increased, and Ana has found herself lacking the capital and resources necessary to keep up with demand. She is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase products to stock her business, including: medicines, creams, deodorant, etc. With good references and a solid history of repayments, Ana Bertha is confident that she can quickly pay back this loan. She hopes that this investment will strengthen her business and bring financial security to her home and family.

loans.use: to purchase medicines, creams and deodorants to stock her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Isatu, from Waterloo, Sierra Leone.  She is married and has two children, aged four and eight years.  They are both currently going to school.  Isatu owns a business, where she sells building materials.  She has been in the business for 15 years.  She works at the business from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., every day of the week.  The business is her only source of income.  Her greatest challenge with the business is covering the costs of transportation and electricity. 

She requested this loan to buy more inventory, such as cement and iron rods, to expand her business.  In five years, she would like to become a distributor of building materials.  She hopes that the extra income from the loan will help to improve her family's living conditions.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory, such as cement and iron rods, to expand her business

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is 30 years old and live in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a 9 year old child who is in school and lives at home.  For the past three years she has been selling soft drinks, a business she started with money that she received from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is the profits that she makes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. In the future she wants to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Please meet 36 year old Mohamed.  He is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 15.  Three of his children currently attend school. Mohamed has a business selling rice and other foodstuffs, such as flour, in Waterloo, which is located near the capital of Freetown.  He started his business 12 years ago because his father and mother passed away and he had to make a living.  He works from 7 am to 7:30 pm, 7 days a week.  His business is his only source of income. He requested this loan to buy rice to expand his business. His dream is to open more shops and also to become a wholesale supplier.  His greatest challenges in the business are transportation and the increase in prices.  He greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy rice to expand his business

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es: Rosa Alicia vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia lo califico como muy bueno para sus actividades comerciales, es concurrido de personas y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y  con un excelente servicio; Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Rosa Alicia tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa Alicia lives with her two children in their own house, and she makes a living selling fruits and vegetables, including: strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chiles and other produce. She has been working in this industry for many years, and has gained valuable experience in buying produce in bulk to generate the best profit margins upon its resale. She sells her produce from a stall in a market, which is a great location for attracting new customers. Rosa Alicia already has a wide customer base, since she sells fresh, high quality produce at affordable prices and with excellent service.

Rosa Alicia is an entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to her work and goals in life, and she is always looking for new opportunities to grow her business and succeed. In recent weeks, customer demand for her produce has increased substantially, and she is now looking for new ways to keep up with demand and invest in her business. Since she does not have the capital necessary to keep up with client demand, she is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL. Rosa Alicia plans to use the support from this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk to stock her business. With good references and a solid history of repayments, Rosa Alicia is confident that she can quickly pay off the loan. She is grateful for this opportunity, which she hopes will strengthen her business and lead to a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk to stock her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 32 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 8 and 17 who are attending school, and live at home. She has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) for the past 8 years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her profits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, fish, meat, charcoal, onions and vita for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, fish, meat, charcoal, onions and vita for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en: Yatta is 30 years old and live in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children aged 3 and 5, both of whom have been living with their father for the past year now. She has been selling used clothes in the local market; she started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Mohamed from Sierra Leone.  He is married with five children between the ages of 4 and 18. All five of the children are attending school.

Mohamed owns an electrical appliance business in Waterloo, just outside of the capital, Freetown.  He works 10 hours per day, 7 days per week at his business.  He decided to go into business because he stopped going to school.  

Mohamed will use the loan proceeds to buy electronic appliances such as lights and plugs. He says transportation from the city to the warehouse is a major challenge for his business. 

He dreams that his business will get big and employ other people. He wants to use the extra income to help his wife and his family. Mohamed greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy electronic appliances such as lights and plugs.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Greetings from Waterloo, Sierra Leone!  This is 39 years old Dauda from Waterloo, located just outside the capital city of Freetown.  He is divorced with four children, from ages 1 to 4.  Three of his children are going to school. Dauda owns a business selling fertilizer and agricultural tools.  He started his business 12 years ago becaused he wanted to improve his standard of living.  He was a farmer previously.  He hopes to one day become a wholesaler and employ other people.  The client faces problems with transportation and storage space. He requested this loan to purchase more fertilizer and tools to sell in his shop.  He wants to use the extra income from the business to expand his business and improve the life of his family.  He greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and tools to sell in his shop

loans.name: Amodu

texts.en: Please meet Amodu from Waterloo, Sierra Leone.  He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 9.  Currently, two of the children are attending school. Amodu has a pharmacy business selling medicine.  He has been in the business for more than 10 years.  He started his business after leaving secondary school.  He works 12 hours per day, from Monday to Sunday. He wants to use this loan to purchase more drugs of various types to stock his pharmacy.  One day he hopes to become a wholesaler of medicine.  He hopes that the extra income from his business will help educate his children and improve his standard of living.  He greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drugs of various types to stock his pharmacy.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Greetings from Jui, Sierra Leone!  This is 37 year old Susan.  She is married with three children, the youngest being 13 years old.  Susan runs a general store selling food provisions and other miscellaneous products.  She started the business 12 years ago in order to help the family.  She works at her business tirelessly, taking only one day off per month.  She says that her business fluctuates often. She is requesting this loan to purchase more products, provisions and foodstuffs for her general store in order to expand her business.  She hopes that the extra income from her business will improve the life of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more products, provisions and foodstuffs for her general store

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Please meet 40 year old Therese from Jui, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children, the youngest of whom is 12 years old. All three of her children currently go to school. Therese owns a general merchandise business where she sells provisions and other dry foodstuffs. She started her store 10 years ago to help develop the family. She works at the store 30 days out of 31 days in a month. She wants to use the loan to buy more inventory such as dry foodstuffs for her store. She hopes to one day have a very big shop. She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as dry foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en: Meet 31 year old Memunatu from Jui, Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children, aged 2 and 12 years old. She started her general merchandise business 13 years ago in order to improve the family. She works almost everyday of the month, only taking one day off. She says one of her big challenges is that business can be unpredictable. She requests this loan to buy more provisions to stock her general store. She hopes that the extra income will help improve her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to stock her general store

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is from the Zaritap village of the Vayots Dzor region. He has been involved in agriculture for many years. His livestock currently includes fives cows and 20 chickens. Garik also owns a plot of land where apricots, nuts, apples and pear trees are grown. Garik works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local market. He gets milk, which he uses in cheese production. Due to his hard work, his cheese is highly in-demand among buyers.  

Agriculture helps Garik to have a stable income, so he would like to expand his farm. He has applied for this loan to pay for four calves. It is very difficult for Garik to save money for the expansion of his farm, because he is the only breadwinner in a big family. His family consists of his father, mother, wife, six-year-old son, and twin boys who are five years old. Garik does his best to sustain his family and ensure a better life for his lovely sons.

loans.use: To pay for four calves

location.town: Zaritap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Norma Yanira

texts.es: Norma Yanira  vive junto a su hija en casa propia; ella posee un comedor vende comida en variedad sopas, carnes, frijoles, ensaladas, frescos, entre otros,  es muy conocida en la zona pues vende los platillos mas exquisitos del lugar, tiene ocho años con el  negocio, esta ubicado en una zona que califico como excelente para su actividad comercial y se siente muy satisfecha al ver que las personas se van contentas del lugar, todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, Norma es una mujer visionaria con muchas ganas de ganarse un futuro más próspero, piensa que si tiene un comienzo tendrá la lucha y si tiene la lucha lograra la victoria, ahora está buscando la lucha y quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carnes, verduras, granos basicos, bebidas etc. Norma Yanira es muy responsable y con un buen record crediticio tiene confianza que podrá saldar la deuda pero sobre todo tiene esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norma Yanira lives with her daughter in their own house, and makes a living operating a small restaurant. She prepares a wide variety of dishes for her  customers, including soups, meats, beans, salads, drinks and other items, and her restaurant is very well known in the area for being a high-quality, delicious establishment. With eight years of experience in the restaurant industry, Norma feels very satisfied with the service she provides to her clients. She prides herself on preparing rich, affordable dishes with excellent service. 

Norma is a woman of vision who works extremely hard to make her dreams a reality. She believes that each new beginning is followed by a struggle, and that every struggle will end in victory. As she is now in that growing, struggling stage of her business, she wants to put forth her best effort and grow her restaurant. She is therefore requesting this loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase ingredients for preparing her food dishes. She plans to purchase: meats, vegetables, staple grains, drinks, etc. With a solid credit history and responsible nature, Norma Yanira is confident that she can quickly repay this loan. She hopes that this opportunity will help her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, staple grains and drinks for preparing dishes in her restaurant.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a young, hardworking 35-year-old man. He hails from the village of Mirama in the Mbarara district. He grew up without his parents after both of them died when he was at a very tender age. Issac was brought up by his grandmother who also died when he was just 15 years old. He then worked on people’s farms where he looked after goats. Because of his trustworthiness, he was given five goats as a gift, which laid the foundation for his success. He looked after those goats, and they multiplied to become over 30 goats. He used some of his goats to make a marriage offer and to acquire land to plant plantains. Last month he sold more than half of his goats to buy a piece of land for the rest of his goats to graze. Issac requests a loan of 1,800,000 UGX to buy building materials to construct a goat shed. He believes the shed will protect his animals from rain as well as diseases linked to poor hygiene. He is a hardworking and resilient young man. Issac is pictured with his wife and a UGAFODE staff member (middle).

loans.use: To construct a goat shed

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Dolores tiene la compañía de su esposo que le ayuda con los gastos del hogar con su empleo como técnico de transformador, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, ha cumplido con su deber de madre apoyándolos en todo, con su empleo ha salido adelante siempre, este es su cuarto crédito que solicita para infraestructura, desea hacer un anexo en su habitación ya que es muy pequeño y necesita más espacio y hacer las paredes de concreto, comprara cemento, bloques, arena. Hierro para empezar la obra.
texts.en:
Dolores has the company of her husband, who helps her with the household costs with his job as an electrical transformer technician. Their children are already independent adults. She has fulfilled her duty as a mother by supporting them with everything. She has always been successful in her work.

She is applying for her fourth loan for the infrastructure of her home. She would like to build an addition on her room, as it is very small and she needs more space and concrete walls. She will buy cement, blocks, sand, and iron to start the construction.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo, una humilde comerciante de 33 años de  edad, originaria de León, casada, madre de 1 hijo de 14 años,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de  lácteos de la que es propietaria hace más de 3 años. Inicio su negocio a la edad de 30 años, motivada por su suegra quien le ayudo a poner su propio negocio de ventas de cuajadas, queso y cremas, ella dice que se siente muy satisfecha porque le va muy bien en su negocio, y al mismo tiempo le genera ganancias a diarias, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su hijo, sus productos lácteos  lo comercializa en su casa, cuenta con otros ingresos como es el dinero que le da su esposo.
Consuelo esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar queso, cuajada, crema. Con el objetivo de comprar por mayor sus productos lácteos, para  incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, una de sus metas próximas es poder establecer otro negocio como es la venta de pollo y otros productos comestibles que le generen nuevos ingresos.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 33, is a humble trader from León. She is married with one fourteen-year-old son. She has had a business selling dairy products for more than three years. 

She started her business at the age of 30, motivated by her mother-in-law who helped her to start up her own business selling cheese, curd and cream. She says that she is very satisfied because her business is going very well, and at the same time she earns a daily income. Her son helps her with her business. She sells the dairy products from her home. She also has another source of income, the money which her husband brings in.

Consuelo is applying for a loan to buy cheese, curd, and cream. Her goal is to buy wholesale dairy products in order to increase her sales and earn a better profit. One of her next goals is to establish another business selling chicken and other food products, which will generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy cheese, curd, and cream.

loans.name: Asmicra Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ASMICRA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dora es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de mochilas y mandiles, tejido de poncho y chompas, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, venta de frescos y dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dara es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializara en las ferias de las comunidades. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Community Association "ASMICRA," is in its first business cycle of affiliation with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) and with the Villa Tejada Community Center. This group is made up of six members and has a board of directors on which Dora serves as treasurer. The group members make a living in various industries, including: backpack and apron manufacturing, poncho and sweater knitting, food sales, vegetable sales, clothing sales and candy/sweet sales.

The support from this loan will be leveraged by the entire group to strengthen their business endeavors. Dora manages a fruit sales business that she started as her own initiative several years ago. Dora joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who was a member of the organization, and this is her first experience with an organization of this kind. She is grateful for the opportunity and support she has received, and for the savings she has been able to build up.

Dora plans to use the support from this loan to purchase fruit from the central markets in El Alto for resale at her business in the smaller fairs and markets in her community. Dora is married with three children, and this job is her source of income for covering household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Tamutswa Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Leo from Masvingo. He is single with no children.  Leo runs a business that sells groceries, hardware and liqour. This business has been in operation for 17 years. He says the main challenge he faces is having enough money to buy more items. Leo has requested a loan of 1000 USD to buy groceries, hardware and liqour. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his profits; thereby, expanding his business and providing employment opportunities for the community. In the future, Leo wishes to grow his business to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, hardware, and liqour

loans.name: Elshadai Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Anna from Mutare. She is married with five children, four attending school. Anna runs a clothing business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 7 years. She says the main challenges she faces are credit sales not perfoming well. Anna has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothing (kids wear and handbags) to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Anna plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rutendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Blantina from Masvingo. She is married with five children, three of which attend school.  

Blantina runs an agricultural business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for four years. She says that the main challenge she faces is running out of stock feed before selling all of her chickens, thereby incurring more costs. 

Blantina has requested a loan of 400 USD to buy chicks, stock feed, and diesel for the grinding mill. She says that the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Blantina plans to buy a truck to transport her chickens to various markets.

loans.use: to buy chicks, stock feed, and diesel for the grinding mill

loans.name: Trinity Stars Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Precious from Mutare. She is married with four children, all attending school.  Precious runs a clothing business selling kids wear, handbags and shoes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge she faces is high custom duty at the border post. Precious has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothing (kids wear, handbags and shoes) to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future Precious plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Revenge Stars Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 24-year-old Shawline from Mutare. She is married with three children, two attending school. She also cares for two dependents. Shawline runs a clothing business selling comforters,suits and curtains. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenge she faces is high custom duty at the border post. Shawline has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothing (comforters,suits and curtains) for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future Shawline plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Besvim Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 58-year-old Betty from Mutare. She is married with six children. Betty runs a clothing business selling kidswear, suits, and footwear. The business has been in operation for 15 years. She says the main challenges faced are high customs duties at the border post. Betty has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothing (kidswear, suits, and footwear) for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future Betty plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy stock and material for business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for their business

loans.name: Orleans Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 30-year-old Sevie from Mutare. She is married with three children, all attending school.  Sevie runs a retail business selling clothes, shoes, TVs and fridges. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are late payments from clients who buy on credit. Sevie has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothing, shoes, tvs and fridges to sell during tobacco sale season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Sevie plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for resale

loans.name: General Pando Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERAL PANDO”  iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras deportivas, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, tejidos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras y deportivos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando con su tía hace varios años,  posteriormente decide abrir su propio espacio de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Community Association "GENERAL PANDO," is in their fifteenth business cycle with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) and with the Senkata Community Center. This group is made up of nine members and is managed by a board of directors on which Julia serves as president. The group members work in various industries, including: sewing sports clothing, food sales, beverage sales, weaving, etc.

The support from this loan will be used to benefit and strengthen the business endeavors of the entire group, including Julia, the group's president. Julia joined Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a member of the institution. Julia runs a small business sewing and selling sports jerseys and jackets. She learned this trade and skill while working with her aunt for several years, and she subsequently decided to open her own workshop. When asked what she appreciates about Pro Mujer, Julia highlighted the financial and health training that the members receive.

With the support from this loan, Julia plans to purchase fabric for use in making her sports garments. She purchases fabrics in bulk from distributors in La Paz, and then uses those fabrics to fulfill client orders. This job has allowed her to generate income for covering household expenses and her family's needs. She is married with two children.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Future Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 54-year-old Norah from Mutare. She is married with four children, one attending school.  Norah runs a retail business selling groceries and clothes. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenges faced are that the profit margin for groceries is very little and there is a high transport cost. Norah has requested a loan of $400 to purchase groceries and clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Norah plans to improve her general family welfare.

loans.use: to buy groceries and clothes for resale

loans.name: Friendly Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 47-year-old Tracy from Mutare. She is married with four children, one attending school.  Tracy runs a retail business selling clothes and kitchen utensils. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are high transportation costs and the duty at the border post. Tracy has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes and kitchen utensils for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Tracy plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Alfred Muranda

texts.en:
Alfred, a father of four, has lived in Mukuru, an informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya, for twenty years. He is among the respected members of the community and owner of some rental houses in the informal settlement.

He is currently employed in one of the industries that surround the informal settlement and has set up a business for his wife. In this way, the family has a constant income every month.

The idea of a Fresh Life toilet was initially hatched by his wife, and he had to talk to an existing owner to make the decision to invest in two. He believes that a Fresh Life toilet will give his family supplemental income.

Alfred wants to grow his toilet business and give his family a decent life for as long as he can.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Josephine from Mutare. She is married with three children, all attending school.  Josephine runs a retail business selling electrical gadgets. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenges faced are the high customs duty at the border post. Josephine has requested a loan of $400 to purchase electrical gadgets for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send children to better schools ands for them to acquire a better education. In the future, Josephine plans to own her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Kushinga Chikanga Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Mary from Mutare. She is married with four children. She also cares for two dependents. Mary runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are high transport costs. Mary has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Mary plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She is working hard to change her home structure. With her long-term partner, she decided to take a loan with Esperanza to continue improving their house.

Carmen has been taking loans with Esperanza International since three years ago. She is receiving her 7th loan, and this one is to build a water tank. She needs to store water because this is the only way they can have a reliable water source.

She is one of the members in the group called Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Shepherd) located in one of the rural villages in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. With this loan she will buy cement, sand, pipes and other materials for water uses. Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their houses while running their businesses and attending their group meetings. Carmen thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is from the Qarakert village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and two children and is involved in agriculture. 

Sara runs a farm, which currently includes 15 cows and 7 pigs. Sara also grows 100 apricot trees with great love and pleasure. She works hard to gather a good harvest, and she sells it in the local market. Sara's husband helps her to run a farm and sustain the family. 

Now Sara needs some financial support for the expansion of her farm. She has applied for this loan to pay for 4 bulls and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Sara to expand her farm and to earn a higher income. That income will enable Sara to cover her family’s basic needs and improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 4 bulls and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Salvador Miguel

texts.es: Salvador de 39 años de edad habita junto a su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia. Es un hombre con diversas capacidades y cualidades que los vecinos, siempre con la disposición de ayudar a quien lo necesita Salvador es muy amable, con los que lo buscan, responsable con sus actividades y méritos diarios. Actualmente se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor, es decir cultiva hortalizas como pepino, rábano y cilantro gracias a su manera de ser posee de clientes quienes lo buscan por precios accesibles y en esta ocasión necesita que INTEGRAL le brinde un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, ya que los que tenia se le terminaron y para esta próxima cosecha necesita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Espera contar con la ayuda puesto que no tiene otros recursos para seguir alimentando a su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and children in his own home. He is a man with diverse abilities and qualities and is always willing to help his neighbors, being friendly when they look for him for whatever they need. He is responsible in his activities and daily production.

He is currently working in farming, that is to say that he grows vegetables such as cucumbers, radishes, and cilantro. Thanks to his personality his customers look for him because of his good prices and on this occasion he needs a loan from Integral in order to purchase agricultural supplies as what he had is depleted and for the next harvest he needs to buy: seed, fertilizer, compost, pesticide and more. He is hoping for help since he does not have other resources to continue feeding his family.

loans.use: to buy seed, compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and more.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International almost seven years ago for a loan to expand her miscellaneous sales business. She joined the group "Esther" in one of the rural villages in San Pedro de Macoris, where she has received loans to invest in her business.
