Обновив и реконструировав теплицы, Наталья сможет получить доход от продажи ранних овощей и фруктов, заработав на нужды семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en: Natalya is a farmer and entrepreneur from the village of Krinky by Novaya Kakhovka. She has been growing greenhouse produce for 16 years. She has 6900 square meters [about two acres] of land and grows early and late varieties of cucumbers, tomatoes, radishes, onions, eggplants [aubergines], raspberries, strawberries, peppers, sweet corn and vegetable marrow. This time Natalya needs financing in order to prepare her greenhouses for the new season, stock up on fertilizers and seeds, buy film and firewood and renovate her greenhouses. After renovating and rebuilding her greenhouses, Natalya will be able to make a profit from selling early varieties of vegetables and fruits and earn funds for the needs of her family and business.

loans.use: to prepare her greenhouses for the new season, stock up on fertilizers and seeds, buy film and firewood as well as renovate her greenhouses.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación ,  trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2011,  se encuentran  en el 5to ciclo, y ya tienen un pequeño ahorro, gracias al esfuerzo de todas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Maria, ella tiene su despensa, está casada con el señor Raúl que trabaja de vendedor, tienen 2 hijos, por quienes ambos se esfuerzan para poder sacarlos adelante y darles todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener.
Cuenta la Sra. Maria que el crédito que solicita a la fundación lo utilizará para la compra de mas yerba, huevos, carnes, verduras, enlatados y demás para surtir mejor su despensa, ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a el crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación emerged from contact with one of the members of the foundation. They have worked with the foundation since 2011, are in their 5th cycle, and already have a small savings, thanks to all their efforts.

One of the members of the group is Maria. She has a small grocery store and is married to Raul, who works as a salesman. They have 2 children, for whom they both strive in order to be able to get ahead and give their children everything that they weren't able to have.

Maria says that she will use the loan she is asking for from the foundation to buy more yerba mate, eggs, meat, vegetables, canned goods and other things to better stock up her pantry. She is very grateful, as thanks to the loan she will be able to improve her earnings and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy yerba mate, eggs, meat, vegetables, canned goods and other things.

loans.name: Paula Isidora

texts.es: La señora Paula, ayuda incondicionalmente a sus tres hijos, en los gastos universitarios para que ellos se preparen y sean profesionales, sus ingresos como conserje son muy bajos, los que no le da para con los diferentes egresos que tiene, por eso opto por poner un negocio de nintendo, el credito es para comprar 3 televisores y 2 nintendos mas,  ya que la demanda es buena y tiene que aprovechar esta oportunidad, esperando que en un futuro pueda poner un comedor o pulpería, siempre contando con el apoyo de financiamiento.
texts.en: Paula unconditionally helps her three children with their university expenses so that they are prepared and become professionals. Their incomes as janitors are very low, and it doesn't cover their various expenditures. This is why she decided to open a Nintendo shop. The loan is to buy three TVs and two more Nintendos, because demand is good and and she has to take advantage of this opportunity. She hopes in the future to start a canteen or a small grocery store, always having the support of financing.

loans.use: to buy three TVs and two Nintendos

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar is a 54-year-old married man from San Miguel, Bohol. He has five grown children. He has been engaged in the farming business for 25 years now. He also has a piggery as his second business. This is the source of his income. He usually earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month.
 
Apolinar is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and medicine. This will be used in his farming business. With the use of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for the productivity of his farm.

In the future, Apolinar hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and medicine.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a dried fish vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 26 years old and has two young children, ages 4 and 1. Clara works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Clara is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. With this loan, she will be able to sell more to the people in her place, thus augmenting her income and budget.

In the future, Clara has hopes of making her business a success and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Ochir

texts.en: Mrs. Ochir is 53 years old and lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, Lodonbaa, works at a local gas station. Her son, Serjhorloo, is a university student. The borrower has been running various kinds of retail businesses since 1995. She is now running a small retail business in a local market. The borrower has gained lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition fees and to cover his living expenses in the capital city. She is a hard-working, positive, and modest woman.

loans.use: To pay her son's university tuition fees and to cover his living expenses in the capital city

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en: Mrs. Lhagvajav is 44 years old and lives with her husband in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, Amgalan, age 43, runs a transportation business in town. The borrower has been running a tailoring service since 1992 at home. She has built close relationships with her customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to meet the demands of her customers. She is a hard-working, kind, and clever woman.

loans.use: To purchase some inventory to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been involved in the rice farming business with her husband for more than 25 years.

Cesaria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these, she will be able to improve their farm, and eventually, their harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is a married man who is 42 years old and from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has three children. The eldest is 16 years old, and the youngest is 7 years old. He has a food-selling business. He sells peanut butter, polvoron, and fresh buko (or coconut juice). He has been in this business for two years now. 
Arnulfo is requesting a loan to purchase additional items for his store. 

In the future, Arnulfo hopes to expand his business. He wants to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for his store

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She is married and runs a business out of her house. She sells milk, salt, fish, noodles, coffee, sugar, Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, books, rice, and bread. She opened her kiosk 1991 with her working capital of $80.00. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She is making a good income from selling and she wants to buy more stock with the loan.

loans.use: To buy milk, salt, fish, noodles, coffee, sugar, Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, books, rice, and bread

loans.name: Dulambayar

texts.en: Dulambayar is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband Altanhuyag, age 51, has a sight defect and has stayed home growing organic vegetables and doing a sales business since 1994. Her children Uuganbaatar, age 18, Altanbayar, age 14 and Osohbayar, age 8, study at local schools. She has been running an organic vegetable and fruit sales business in a local market for years. She is now requesting 2,350,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetables and fruits to sell in her rental counter at a local market. She is a hardworking and talkative person.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables and fruits to sell in her rental counter at a local market

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is a 55-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has three children — the eldest is 17 and the youngest is 11. She has engaged in farming business for 17 years now. She has a second business which is fishing. Her husband is a fisherman. These are the sources of her income. 

Emeliana is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer, fish net, and gasoline. The fertilizer will be use for her farming business. She wants to buy the fish net and gasoline for her fishing business. With the help of this loan, she will be able to pay for the needs of her two businesses to be more productive and profitable.

In the future, Emeliana hopes to expand her businesses. She is also hoping to buy another boat.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fish net, and gasoline

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar is 44 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband Narangerel runs a small butcher shop in a local market. Her child, Budjav, age 18, is a university student and Tsolmon, age 15, Badamhand, age 13, and Uranzaya, age 6, study at local schools. She has been running a butcher shop with her husband since 2000. She has been covering her family expenses from her business profits and her son has just enrolled in a university this year. Soon they will have two more university students and need to save more for their further education. She is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition fee. She is a hardworking, communicative and honest woman.

Picture: Borrower is in the storage pit and posing in front of livestock pelts which she also sells to animal pelt retailers

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition fee

loans.name: Judith Elizabeth

texts.es:
Judith una humilde joven, de 27 años de edad, con deseo de superación, se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos, originaria de Managua, casada, madre de 1 hijos de 5 años de edad,  estudia su  tercer año de contabilidad. Inicio con capital propio con ayuda de su papa quien se dedicaba a vender perfumes de la línea de cosméticos, luego con el tiempo su  papa viaja a Costa Rica para buscar una mejor vida, fue allí que decidió dejarle el negocio a su hija para que ella lo administrara, la cual con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido sacar adelante, ya que con las ganancias que le genera su negocio ha podido continuar pagando sus estudios universitarios, una de las razones de Judith al mantener estable  su propio negocio es para evitar trabajarles a otras persona. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Judith solicita el financiamiento para comprar cosméticos como, perfumes, cremas, con el objetivo de comprar todos los cosméticos que aun no tiene en inventario, y a la misma vez hacer crecer su negocio cada día mas, para poder incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es poder tener su propia empresa de perfumes, para darles empleos a otras personas , una de sus metas próximas es poder terminar sus estudios universitarios, con la idea de tener mejor oportunidad y desarrollarse como una profesional.
texts.en:
Judith is a humble young woman. She is 27 years old and desires to get ahead in life. She is from Managua and works selling cosmetics. She is married, is the mother of a 5-year-old child, and is in her third year of accounting studies. She started her business with her own capital and with assistance from her father who also works selling perfumes from the line of cosmetics. Later, her father traveled to Costa Rica in search of a better life and from there decided to leave the business to his daughter so she could manage it. She was able to do this through tremendous effort and hard work, and in doing so she was able to earn enough to continue to pay for her university education. One of Judith's reasons for maintaining her own business was to avoid working for other people. Her husband helps her manage her business. 

Judith is requesting this loan in order to purchase cosmetic items such as perfumes and lotions in order to purchase all of the cosmetic items she does not currently have in stock, while also growing her business more each day by being able to increase her sales and earn more income. In the future she hopes to have her own perfume company and be able to provide employment for others. One of her next goals is to complete her university studies in order to have more opportunities and to develop more as a professional.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics such as perfumes and lotions.

loans.name: Ana Tisel

texts.es:
Ana de 26 años de edad, es madre cabeza de familia de 2 hijos de seis y diez años.  Tras sufrir el abandono de su esposo, esta mujer tomó las obligaciones del hogar con el propósito de sacar su familia adelante. 
Con pocas oportunidades para emplearse debido a su bajo nivel educativo, optó por dedicarse a la venta de mercancía, actividad que le permite compartir con su familia y generar los ingresos suficientes para la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos.

En la actualidad, Ana tiene mucha clientela, la cual le solicita constantemente ropa y calzado, pedidos que no ha logrado satisfacer, debido a que no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar las compras a sus proveedores. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su mayor deseo, más allá de alcanzar una estabilidad económica, es poder brindarles a sus hijos mejores concisiones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old. She is the mother and head of the family for two children ages six and ten. After being abandoned by her husband, she took over the obligations of managing the household in order to get her family ahead. With few opportunities for employment due to her lack of education, she opted to work as a merchandiser, which allows her to spend time with her family while also earning sufficient income to feed and educate her children.

Currently Ana has many customers who are constantly requesting clothing and footwear. She has not been able to fill all these orders due to the fact that she does not have sufficient funds to make the necessary purchases from her providers. For this reason she is requesting a loan with the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales. Her greatest hope--beyond even securing financial stability--is being able to provide a better condition of living for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Ángela tiene 23 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de cinco años, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Primero de Mayo,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ángela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un Frízer que le hace falta para conservar la carne, verduras,  y refrescos su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra frizer, la Sra. Ángela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, la Sra. Ángela es una persona joven con ganas de superación su deseo es poder tener un restaurante y así brindar una mejor atención a su clientela.
texts.en: Ángela is 23 years old, she has a son who is 5 years old, and she works selling food from her storefront located in the Primero de Mayo district. This will be her first loan cycle with this institution. Ángela will use the loan to purchase a freezer which she can use to preserve food such as meets, vegetables, and drinks. She does not currently have the funds necessary to purchase the freezer on her own. Ángela faces challenges in her business which include expanding her customer base, but this will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family. Ángela is a young person with the desire to get ahead in life, and her goal is to be able to open a restaurant and so be able to better serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Uuganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his parents and two siblings in Ger, Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. His father is retired and stays home, while his mother works as a librarian at a local library. Uuganbaatar's siblings are university students. 

Uuganbaatar has been running a clothing sales business in a rental counter of a local market since last year. He has gained a lot of experience in the business and already has regular customers. He is now requesting a 3,300,000 MNT loan to pay his siblings' university tuition. He is a hard-working, energetic and goal-oriented person.

loans.use: to pay his siblings' university tuition fee

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.
Lydia has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Raymond's Group

texts.en:
Raymond is an eighty-one year old farmer and father of sixteen children. His wife is also a farmer. Regular periods of drought cause them to lose some or all of their crops.

Raymond decided to join the KOMAZA program as a tree farmer in order to reduce his poverty level. He hopes to use the proceeds from his tree farm to educate his children and invest in cattle.

Also pictured with the group of twelve are Nyevu, Elizabeth and Nzingo. They are all interested in the KOMAZA micro forestry program but were unable to join this planting season.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Ma. Mely

texts.en:
Ma. Mely is 43 years old and married with one child. Ma. Mely works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Mely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, eggs, canned goods, etc..
Ma. Mely has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Ma. Mely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store like snack foods, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en: Mr. Odbayar is 27 years old and lives with his wife and 2 sons in a ger in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife Pagma, age 29, works at local construction company. His sons Enhtemujin, age 3 and Enhtemulen, age 1 go to a local kindergarten. Odbayar has been providing taxi services in town since 2010. He is now starting an auto repair service on their plot of land. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and tools to start his auto repair service. He is a hardworking, enthusiastic and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools to start his auto repair service.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, fish, milk, coffee, sugar, salt and bread. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Filomena is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, fish, milk, coffee, sugar, salt and bread for her kiosk.

loans.name: Farangiz

texts.en: Farangiz is 22 years old. She is married but has no children at this time. She is a hardworking and industrious woman who lives with husband in an old and uncomfortable house. Her husband is a kind man but his income is small and that’s why Farangiz must find a source of income. She can sew a national slicker for men called a chapon. She is now going to organize her own business. She completed a course called ‘To get ahead’ through a women’s organization and learned skills about running a business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoin to buy fabrics and other necessary things for sewing chapons. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her new sewing business.

loans.name: Shida's Group

texts.en:
Shida is a twenty-eight year old farmer and mother of five children. She and her husband keep goats and poultry, and grow food crops. Their business is frequently affected by drought. Shida cannot find another job as she is illiterate.

Shida decided to become a KOMAZA tree farmer to generate income to educate her children and improve the family's standard of living. She also hopes the trees will improve the environment. With the money from harvesting her trees, Shida hopes she can send her children to college and invest in livestock.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia works hard to support her family. Nadia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
Nadia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.
Nadia has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Nadia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 42-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has two children. The youngest is 7 while the oldest is 18. She is engaged in a basket-weaving business. She makes baskets made of buri (native palm). She has been weaving baskets for six years. Her husband is a farmer.

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy buri (native palm) and wicker (woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture). These  materials are very essential in basket weaving. In the future, Cecilia would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy buri (native palm) and wicker (woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture).

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 63 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Nimfa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nimfa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.
Nimfa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nimfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, ella es una mujer muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. Ella trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés, el cual elabora ella sola a primeras horas de la madrugada para poder venderlo antes del desayuno, que es cuando las personas más lo consumen al igual que en la cena. Así mismo Ana también comercializa zapatos y sandalias, lo que le brinda una gran ayuda económica. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ana lives with her husband and two children.  She is a very responsible woman who is always looking to improve her financial stability.  She works in her own bakery where she makes French bread.  She prepares it on her own in the small hours of the morning so she can sell it before breakfast, which along with dinnertime is when people eat it the most.  Ana also sells shoes and sandals, which is a great financial help to her.  She is asking INTEGRAL for a loan so she will have the help she needs to invest in flour, yeast, lard, tins, and everything she needs to increase her production.  This project for improving her bakery is very important to her because it will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bread

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Mr. Natsagdorj is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Buren, age 36, runs cobbler service at home. His daughter Solongo, age 10, goes to a local primary school and son Gerelt-Od, age 4, goes to local kindergarten. Natsagdorj has been running a general store at a local market for years. He is now starting a butcher shop on a rental counter of the local market and is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of meat products from herders. He is a hardworking, neat and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase large amount of meat products from herders for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. Charito is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Charito requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, biscuits, eggs, canned goods and other groceries.

Charito has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Charito would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, biscuits, eggs, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Vinda

texts.en: Vinda is a 43-year-old married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has 7 children. The oldest child is 23 while the youngest is 4. She is engaged in making calamay. Calamay is made from ground rice, coconut milk, brown sugar, peanut butter and margarine and it is packaged inside a coconut shell fastened by a red strip. She has been making calamay for 20 years. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, brown sugar and empty coconut shells. Vinda would like to expand her business to continue to support her family and also to be able send her children to school to provide them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, brown sugar and empty coconut shells for her production of calamay.

loans.name: Sainbileg

texts.en: Sainbileg is 20 years old and lives with his parents and two siblings in a house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His father runs a small business, his mother works at a local insurance company and his two siblings study at local schools. The borrower is starting his own taxi service business in town and is now requesting 500,000 MNT to fix his car. He is a hardworking and responsible young man.

loans.use: to fix his car to provide a taxi service.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Genaro is a 44-year-old married man from Albur, Bohol. He has three children. The eldest is 22 and the youngest is 13 years old. He engages in making calamay, a sticky sweet delicacy. He has been in this business for 25 years. He earns 10,000 PHP each month. This is the source of his income.
Genaro is requesting a loan to buy two sacks of glutinous rice, sugar, and a plastic box. These are the ingredients that are used in making calamay. The plastic box is used to store the calamay. In the future, Genaro hopes to expand his business. He wants to send his children to school. He is also hoping for a better life.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of glutinous rice, sugar and a plastic box.

loans.name: Zvikomborero Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Ivy from Mutare. She is married with four children, three attending school. Ivy sells chickens to catering businesses and for home consumption. The business has been in operation for 4 years. She says the main challenge faced is late payment from clients who buy on credit. Ivy has requested a loan of $400 to purchase feed for her chickens. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s general welfare. In the future Ivy hopes that her children can go to better schools.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Vimbo Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 49 year old Miriam from Mutare. She is widowed with four children, two attending school. She also cares for two dependents. Miriam runs a retail business selling clothes, blankets and kitchenware. The business has been in operation for 12 years. She says the main challenges faced are high transport costs. Miriam has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes, blankets and kitchenware. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Miriam plans to own her own boutique shop and send her children to better schools.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as clothes, blankets and kitchenware to re-sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther works hard to support her family. Esther is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Esther requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. Esther has been in this business for 14 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Esther successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Previledge Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 33 year old Evelyn from Mutare. She is divorced with three children, all attending school.  Evelyn runs a retail business selling clothes and shoes. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are high custom duty at the border post. Evelyn has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes and shoes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Evelyn plans to own a boutique shop in town.

loans.use: to buy more stock to re-sell.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, que se dedican a estudiar. María es una persona con el don de poder elaborar ropa de cama y para almohadas, las cuales también comercializa en su casa de habitación y así mismo de forma ambulante. María se dedica de lleno a su trabajo al mismo tiempo que cuida a sus hijos y se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, siendo una mujer multifacética. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar diferentes tipos de telas, con distintos estampados, así mismo para la compra de hijos de colores, esto le permitirá elaborar más ropa de cama y así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: María lives with her husband and her two children who are both under 18 and currently studying.  María has a gift for making bed clothes which she also sells both from her house and as a street vendor.  María gives her all to her work, as well as looking after her children and doing all the housework - she is a multitasker.  She is applying for a loan to buy different types of materials, with different designs, as well as to buy coloured threads.  This will allow her to make more bed clothes and thus increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy different types of materials to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paper, iron and bottles to sell.

loans.name: Flash Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40 year old Maybe from Mutare. She is married with three children, two attending school.  Maybe runs a business selling chickens to catering businesses and for home consumption. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is the small space available for the business. Maybe has requested a loan of $400 to purchase feeds for her poultry business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Maybe plans to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her poultry business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrella is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Estrella has a business buying and selling fermented shrimp in the Philippines. Estrella requested a loan of 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fermented shrimp to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fermented shrimp to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood in bulk to sell on.

loans.name: Proverbs Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40 year old Dazzie from Mutare. She is married with five children, all attending school.  Dazzie runs a business selling stockfeed and chicks. The business has been in operation for one year. She says the main challenges faced are shortages of stockfeed and medicine for chicks. Dazzie has requested a loan of $400 to buy stockfeed and chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Dazzie plans to be able to supply big companies and employ people.

loans.use: to buy stockfeed and chicks

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is a 46-year-old farmer. She is a single mother of two children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family. Kanini is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after she was recently introduced by a KADET staff member. 

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings to yield more produce. With the anticipated profits from the business she will purchase more dairy cows. 

Her dream is to venture into large scale farming and improve family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is a 41-year-old married man from San Miguel, Bohol. He has seven children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is five months. He has engaged in a farming business for 10 years. He also engages in making amakan or bamboo matting as his second business. He earns 5000 PHP in a month. This is the source of his income.
Guillermo is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and bamboo. The fertilizer will be used in his farming business and the bamboo will be used in making amakan or bamboo matting. Through this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for the productivity of his businesses. In the future, Guillermo hopes to expand his business. He also wants to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and bamboo

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs.Uranchimeg is a 38-year-old female head of family. She lives with her son on her sister's plot of land in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Bilguun, age 13, goes to the local school. The borrower has been running a clothing business in the local market since 2002. She has also been working as a tailor in local companies for years. She has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her clothing sales business. She is a hardworking, tough and honest woman who says "I need to raise my child to be highly educated and let him be able to live on his own someday".

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her clothing sales business in the rental counter of the local market

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the rice farming business for several years now. This is the source of his income.
Joel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm and his harvest and yield. Joel dreams of expanding his farm in the future so that it will generate the revenue necessary for the needs and expenses of the family and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 53 years old and married with seven children.

Phoebe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Phoebe has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 20 years and also earns an income from selling coconut wine.

Phoebe aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a new client in this institution. He is a farmer engaged in cattle keeping. Cows are his source of income and livelihood. John is married with five children. Four of them are now in the higher institutions of learning, something that has proved very costly for John. Because of this, John wants to buy cows, fatten them and then sell them later. Part of the money will be used to pay tuition for his children and John treasures it so much and is excited about it. He did not go to school but he declares that his children have to go school so that they can live a better future. He has been in this business for the last ten years and the challenges he faces are unreliable weather, price fluctuations, pests and diseases, but these cannot stop him from doing his business.

loans.use: To buy more cows and pay school fees

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 33 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y de mucha confianza, él vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a sus tres hijos. Jorge posee un taller en el que se dedica a reparar y pintar automóviles, así mismo vende llantas usadas y otros repuestos.  Él es muy dedicado a la actividad que realiza, es confiable, siendo muy conocido por estas características lo que le vale para tener varios clientes. Jorge solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda comprar nuevas herramientas para la reparación de automóviles y así mismo para la compra de más repuestos, con lo que pueda aceptar más trabajo y de este modo mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
33-year-old Jorge is a very responsible and reliable person.  He lives with his wife, who looks after their home, and their three children.  Jorge owns a garage where he repairs and paints cars.  He also sells used tires and other spare parts.  He is very much committed to his business.  People know that he is a trustworthy man and, for this reason, he has a number of customers.  

Jorge is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy new tools for repairing cars.  He will also buy more spare parts.  This will allow him to take on more work and thereby improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for repairing cars

loans.name: Tserenhand

texts.en:
Mrs.Tserenhand is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a house in Orhon province in Mongolia. Her husband, Saruulsaihan, age 38, runs their family business of organic dairy products sales in the local market. Her children, Bulgan-Erdene, age 8, goes to the local primary school, while Suhbat, age 5, and Bulgantsetseg, age 2, go to the local kindergarten. 

Tserenhand has been running an organic dairy products sales business in town since 2008. She sells her organic dairy products to retailers in the local market. She is now planning to rent a counter in the local market and sell directly to customers. She is requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell to local customers from her rental counter in the local market. She is a hardworking, welcoming and friendly. woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: Noé de 63 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y junto a tres hijos. Noé trabaja desde hace varios años en la comercialización de ropa para damas y hombres, la cual vende de forma ambulante, durante toda la semana Noé tiene una ruta trazada destinando una colonia, cantón o pueblo para cada día de la semana, lo que le permite abarcas más lugares y a más clientes. Noé solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de shorts, camisas, faldas, calcetines y otros más, teniendo la esperanza que esto le permita contar con más clientes y al mismo tiempo le genere mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
63-year-old Noé lives with his wife and three children.  For a number of years now, he has been selling men's and women's clothing door to door.   Noé draws out a route for the whole week and will visit a different housing development, canton or village every day of the week.  This allows him to cover more places and more customers.  

Noé is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying shorts, shirts, skirts, socks and other products.  He hopes that this will gain him more customers and make him more profits.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts and pants to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: A $1,000 loan is offered to Jacinta to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, like noodles, bread, soap, rice, coffee and sugar. Jacinta is generating a good income from selling her items from the kiosk. She is living in town with her family, and she has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in operating her current business.

loans.use: To buy noodles, bread, salt, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Ma.febrica

texts.en: Ma.Febrica is a 58-year-old married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has 3 adult children, and the youngest is 17 years old. She owns and operates a small drug store in the community. She sells medicines that are affordable to customers, yet effective. She has been operating a small drug store for almost 5 years. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy more medicines to sell to avoid a shortage of supply.  Ma.Febrica would like to invest in other ventures in order to open up a mini-pharmacy someday.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from selling coconut wine.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Aduluf

texts.en:
Aduluf is a repeat client in his fourth cycle. He is married and has four children, and all of them attend school. Aduluf applied for a loan of three million shillings to construct a simple structure store for his products. He has been in this business for the last four years, but his business lacks enough capital to construct a store and this is the reason why he applied for a loan. 

After constructing the store, he will have enough space to accommodate his children as well. Apparently they are inconvenienced with sharing the small space with the bread and cakes. Aduluf's business is doing well because his products are good and he also has ready demand and market. He employs five boys who have bicycles to transport his cakes and bread to different markets. Schools, retail shops and local markets are his daily customers. 

Aduluf dreams of building a very big bakery in the next five years, though he currently has challenges of competition, lack of storage facilities and the ever increasing prices of baking powder and sugar, but he is hopeful that these will be solved.

loans.use: To construct a store.

loans.name: Deodilyn

texts.en:
Deodilyn is 43 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, snack foods, etc.

She has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Deodilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 37 years old, married, and a father of three children. For the past seven years, he has earned a living by repairing bicycles in Mpeketoni, Lamu.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his fourth loan of KES 50,000. He is going to use the loan to purchase additional working tools such as spanners, as well as spare parts such as wheel rims, chains and so on needed in his business. 

James will use the profits to pay school fees for his children as well as to continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business, so that he could improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment such as wrenches and a small welding machine.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.en:
Eulalio is a 57-year-old married man from Antequera, Bohol. He has 5 children. Four are adults and the youngest is 14 years old. He is engaged in a motorcycle transport business. He transports customers from one place to another for a certain fee. He has been operating his motorcycle transport business for 3 years. 

He requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy tires, fuel and maintenance for the motorcycle. In the future, Eulalio would like to expand his business to have a sustainable livelihood and in preparation for his old age.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel and maintenance.

loans.name: Mukiyati

texts.en:
Mukiyati, 43, is married to Abdullah, 44. They are blessed with 4 children: Priyanto, 24; Asmar, 23; Nurlaela, 18; Nurmawati, 15. Nurlaela and Nurmawanti are attending school. 

Mukiyati has owned a catering business since 2003. Twice a week, she receives orders from some agencies to provide lunch or snacks for office meetings or another occasion. Her business is running well and the income generated is quite good enough to meet her household needs. 

Later on, Mukiyati wants to initiate a food stall where she could sell more foods, not just those based on orders. She realizes that the limitation of capital she has could not help her to implement her dream. Therefore, she applied for a loan from TLM of IDR 4,500,000. This loan would allow her to buy some equipment such as a stove, a cooking pot and a frying pan, dozens of plates, spoons and glasses, and also basic ingredients such as rice, vegetables and others.

loans.use: to buy some equipment such as a stove, a cooking pot and a frying pan, dozens of plates, spoons and glasses, and also basic ingredients such as rice, vegetables and others.

loans.name: La Bendición 2 Group

texts.es:
La Bendicion 2 es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 personas, cada una de ellas tiene una actividad economica; Roberta venta de dulces, Alba venta de antojitos, Luz Yahel venta de abarrotes, Josefina venta de leña, Elena venta de dulces, Pedro servicio de taxi, Angel Maddiel venta de dulces y Roberta venta de calzado. Este grupo esta ubicado en Acatlan de Perez Figueroa un municipio del estado de Oaxaca, el cual por ser municipio tiene mucho comercio ya que personas de las comunidades cercanas vienen aquí a comprar sus mercancías y productos que necesita.
Luz Yahel o luz (como la llaman en su comunidad) tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, la cual esta ubicada en su hogar desde hace un poco mas de 2 años, cuando ella abrió su propio negocio fue porque quería trabajar en su tiempo libre para contribuir con el gasto de su hogar y hablando con su esposo decidieron poner una tienda en casa ella no tuviera que salir y descuidar a sus hijos.
Ella dijo "antes que nada gracias a Vision Fund cree en nosotros y nos ayuda a crearnos una propia fuente de empleo para nosotros que también beneficia a mi familia" 
Luz tiene la edad de 36 años, solo estudio la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Eloy con el cual tiene un hijo. 
Un prestamo de Vision Fund le ayudara a comprar de frijol, arroz, aceite, jabon, pasta dental, sopa, papel higienico, galletas, azucar, sal, productos en la tados, dulces y refrescos para resurtir su negocio.
Sus planes a futuro son darle a sus hijo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera y una mejor vida, también quiere que su negocio continué progresando y surtirlo mas.
Este grupo envia Gracias a las personas que harán posible su crédito.
texts.en:
La Bendicion 2 is the name of this group, made up of eight people who each have their own business activities. Roberta sells sweets, Alba sells snacks, Luz Yahel sells groceries, Josefina sells firewood, Elena sells candy, Pedro has a taxi service, Angel Maddiel sells sweets, and Roberta sells footwear. The group is located in Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, a municipality of the state of Oaxaca. Since it is a municipality, it has a lot of business activity because people from the surrounding towns come here to buy the merchandise and goods that they need.

Luz Yahel, or Luz, as she is called in her community, has had a small grocery store in her home for a little more than two years. She opened her own business because she wanted to work in her free time to contribute to the home expenses, and after speaking with her husband they decided to put a store in their home so that she did not have to leave her home and neglect the children.

She said, "First of all, I would like to thank Vision Fund for believing in us and helping us to create our own sources of employment, which also helps my family."

Luz is 36 years old and only studied in high school. She is married to Eloy, with whom she has one child.

This loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy beans, rice, oil, soap, toothpaste, soup, toilet paper, cookies, sugar, salt, canned goods, sweets, and soft drinks to restock her business.

Her plans for the future are to give her son the opportunity to study a profession and to have a better life. She also wants her business to continue improving and to stock it more.

This group sends its thanks to the people who will make their loan possible.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, oil, soap, toothpaste, soup, toilet paper, cookies, sugar, salt, canned goods, sweets, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kuña Rory 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación está en su ciclo numero 4, donde todas las integrantes son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan por dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Lidia tiene una pequeña despensa, está casada con el señor Carlos que trabaja de también en la despensa ayudándola, tienen 2 hijos, quienes son el pilar de ambos y por quienes luchan incansablemente para darles todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener.
Cuenta la Sra. Lidia que solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, carnes, bebidas, frutas, yerba, arroz, fideos, y demás y de esa forma tener bien surtido su negocio y seguir dando a su clientela buena variedad.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación is in its fourth cycle. All of its members are women and heads of their households who work hard to give their families all that they need.

One of the members of the group is Lidia, who has a small grocery store. She is married to Carlos, who also works in the store to help her. They have two children, who are a pillar for both of them. They fight tirelessly to give their children everything that they could not have themselves.

Lidia says that she has applied for this loan to buy vegetables, meat, drinks, fruit, herbs, rice, noodles, and other items so that she can stock her business well and continue offering a good variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, drinks, fruit, herbs, rice, noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Milagros 1 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su noveno ciclo, donde todas ellas son amigas y vecinas y están luchando unidas por el bien de sus familias. Son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus hijos, ya que no quieren que pasen por necesidades.
una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Gregoria quien tiene 2 hijos con el Señor Agustin, cuenta que hace varios años que tiene una despensa en su casa con la cual surte a su barrio. Comenta Gregoria que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que después, gracias al trabajo que hace y a su esfuerzo ha podido crecer y llegar a donde este hoy.
Ella solicita del crédito para la compra de insumos de primera necesidad para su despensa, como ser leche, verduras, carnes, mandioca, frutas, enlatados y demás, ya que quiere tener siempre buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
This group is in its ninth cycle. All of the members are friends and neighbors who are fighting together for the benefit of their families. They are women and heads of their households who fight for their children because they do not want them to lack for anything.

One of the members of this group is Gregoria, who has two children with Agustin. She says that she has had a grocery store in her home for several years, with which she serves her neighborhood. Gregoria says that she started with a small business, but later, thanks to her work and effort, she managed to grow her business and get to where she is today.

She has applied for this loan to buy staple goods for her grocery store, such as milk, vegetables, meat, cassava, fruit, canned goods, and other items. She always wants to have good products to offer to her clients and to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, vegetables, meat, cassava, fruit, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Virgen Del Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Comité Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro así se denomina el grupo conformado en fecha 18 de noviembre  del 2.009, integrado por 15 mujeres en sus inicios, y actualmente 13 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando con el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, en el 8º ciclo.
Este grupo se formó gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Marcia logró juntas a todas sus vecinas y amigas que querían trabajar. Marcia cuenta que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa en su casa y con este negocio es que tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia. Cuenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela y que esta mejorando gracias a su esfuerzo.
Solicita de este crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc. Y con esto poder surtir su negocio para seguir su trabajo.
texts.en:
Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro Committee is the name of a group founded on November 18th 2009. There were 15 women in the beginning and currently there are 13 women who are working with the Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepreneurs Program) and are in their 8th loan cycle. 
This group was formed thanks to the current Director of Finance, Marica, who brought together all her neighbors and friends who wanted to work. Marcia says that she works in sales as she has a grocery store in her house and this business gives her the income that she needs to be able to help her family. She says that she already has good customers and that the business is improving thanks to her efforts.
She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, yerba, etc. With these things she will be able to supply her store and keep working.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, yerba, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Epifania quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir está mejorando mucho gracias al trabajo que hace y sumada a la capacitaciones que recibe. Ella se dedica a la venta de hortalizas, helados, ensaladas de frutas, etc., como se puede ver es una persona que se ha esforzado mucho y por eso está saliendo adelante y creciendo en lo que hace.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de semillas , lo que le ayudará a seguir con el cultivo de sus hortalizas y así poder concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Women Entrepreneurs is in its 6th loan cycle with the Programa de Comité de Mujeres, where they all work and which helps them to be successful. They have taken the poverty elimination survey. 
One of the members is Epifania who, in her latest survey, demonstrated she was at poverty level 3 - that is to say, that she has improved greatly thanks to the work that she does and to the training that she has received. She works selling vegetables, ice cream, fruit salads, etc. As you can see, she is a person who has strived hard and, as a result, is getting ahead and growing.
She is requesting a loan to buy seeds which will help her cultivate her vegetables and implement her business plan and this will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seed for sowing time.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, son 12 mujeres que están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, quien además es la presidenta del grupo, tiene un pequeño negocio que es una despensa. Ella quiere que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y con ganas de superarse.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de artículos de librería ya que se aproximan las fechas para el inicio de clases y quiere de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Guapa is in its first loan cycle with the Programa de Comité de Mujeres. The group is from the city of Caaguazú and consists of 12 women who are learning to work together and who joined-up with the goal of helping one another.
Maria is one of the members and is also president of the group. She has a little business which is a general store. She hopes that, as time passes, and with the help of all the other people in the areas, she will be able to improve. She is a very enterprising person and wants to overcome her challenges. 
She is requesting this loan to buy stationary items as classes will be starting again soon. With these, she hopes to keep growing her business and to be able to give her family what they need for a life without deprivation.

loans.use: to buy stationary goods to sell in the store.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS HORMIGUITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Tania ella es conviviente y tiene 32 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ladrillos, tejas y bloquetas, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ladrillos, por medio de su negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ladrillos, tejas y bloquetas.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de fábrica de zapatos y negocio de salchipapas.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LAS HORMIGUITAS” [The Little Ants] communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco in the province and department of Cuzco. 

One member's name is Tania. She is 32, in a common law marriage and has 2 children. She works at her business selling bricks, roof tiles and cinder block. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m,. She has been doing this business for 8 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the brick selling. She gets her children ahead with this business. She is asking for the loan to buy bricks, roof tiles and cinder blocks. 

The other members sell bricks, selling groceries, a shoe factory and selling french fries.

Tania is grateful to those who have been a part of this dream and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bricks, roof tiles and cinder blocks. .

loans.name: Tres De Mayo De Ancachuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE ANCACHURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Livia ella es casada y tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganadería, la socia tiene ganados que los hace engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias o mercados, la socia se dedica a este negocio 10 años y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ganadería, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar 1 ganado y alimentos para los ganados.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ganadería y negocio de crianza de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Tres de Mayo de Ancachuro. This bank is located in the district of Anta which is in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.
The featured member is Livia, who is married, 40 years old, and has 2 children. This member works in her cattle-raising business. She has cattle that she fattens and later sells at the various fairs or markets. She has been doing this for 10 years it is going well - by means of this business, Livia is helping her children to get ahead. Her dream is to grow her livestock business. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She is requesting a loan to buy 1 cow and cattle feed.
The other members work in agriculture, run a grocery store, sell cattle, and raise animals.
This member is grateful to the people who form part of her dream in this way and promises to make her repayments according to the agreement.

loans.use: to buy a cow and cattle feed.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El Sr. David tiene 32 años, está comprometido con la Sra. Karina de 25 años de edad, ellos aun no conocen la dicha de tener hijos.
Don David se inició en la venta de repuestos para motocierras hace más de cuatro años,   aproximadamente desde el año: 2.008, el comenzó siendo secretario de otra persona que trabaja en la venta de repuestos para motocierras, durante más de 10 años. Su papá lo ayudo para empezar con un pequeño capital. En la actualidad el tiene un vehículo con el cual realiza su trabajo en diferentes zonas del país, contando con muchos cliente formados.
Este crédito le servirá para comprar más productos como: (pistón, aro, cigüeñal, escape). Y con esto poder seguir con sus ventas y seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes que siempre tiene muchas ventas.
texts.en:
David is 32 years old. He is engaged to Karina, who is 25 years old. They haven't been blessed yet with children. David has been selling replacement parts for chainsaws more than four years, since about 2008. He started as a secretary for someone else who sold chainsaw replacement parts, for more than 10 years. His father helped him start out with a little capital. Right now, he has a vehicle that he uses to do his job in different parts of the country. He has a lot of regular customers.

This loan will be used to buy more products such as: a piston, a hubcap, a crankshaft and an exhaust pipe. With this, he can continue with his sales to his customers, because he always sells a lot.

loans.use: to buy a piston, a hubcap, a crankshaft and an exhaust pipe.

loans.name: Po Joaju Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado PO JOAjU está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, de 15 integrantes; 3 señoras  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y están luchando por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariza, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ha ido mejorando y creciendo hasta llegar a como está el día de hoy. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todas clases y con esto tiene los ingresos con los que ayuda a su familia. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que lucha día a día y fruto de su trabajo es todo lo que ha conseguido.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frío y quiere poder surtir su negocio y seguir dando variedad a sus clientes, además esto la ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Po Joaju is in its 9th loan cycle with the Programa de Comité de Mujeres where they all work and which is helping them to get ahead. They have taken the poverty elimination survey. There are 15 members of the group and 3 of the women are below the poverty line and are fighting to get ahead.
One of the members is Mariza who, in her latest survey, demonstrated that she is at poverty level 3. Through toil and constant work she has been able to improve and grow to reach the point she is at today. She works selling all types of clothes and this brings her the income that she needs to help her family. She is a self-sacrificing person who strives day in and day out and everything that she has achieved is the fruit of her hard work. She is requesting this loan to buy winter clothes as the cold weather is coming and she wants to stock her business and to keep offering variety to her customers. This will also help her to implement her business plan which will help her to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariano, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y ganadería, tiene 44 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, actualmente están estudiando, Mariano está dedicado a la ganadería y granos básicos ya que lo aprendió de sus padres, realiza el trabajo de arado de la tierra con bueyes en sus propios terrenos y tambien a otras personas particulares.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla, pago de arrendamiento del terreno y compra de abono, esto le ayudara para cultivar dos manzanas de tierra y por lo tanto tener la posibilidad de una buena producción e ingresos por la venta.
La aspiración de él es fortalecer el negocio, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariano, age 44, devotes himself to growing basic grains and livestock.  He is married and has two children, ages seven and five.  The children go to school.  

Mariano is devoted to livestock and basic grains because he learned this from his parents.  He does the plowing work with oxen on his own land and for other individuals.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, to pay for renting the land, and to buy manure.  This will help him to cultivate two ‘manzanas’ [Central American unit of land measurement].  He will then have the possibility of a good production and good income from the sale.  

His aspiration is to strengthen the business and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, and to rent the land.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupé Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen Caacupé  está en su ciclo número dos del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están trabajando arduamente y están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
La integrante es la Sra. Aurora esta por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero ella lucha incansablemente para poder ir creciendo, es una persona que persevera y esta con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ella se dedica a hacer tortas de todo tipo,  y cuenta que siempre tiene buenos pedidos y que sus clientes están muy conformes con su trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir luchando, ya que quiere mejorar sus ingresos y así ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de harina, huevos, manteca, azúcar y demás ingredientes para seguir haciendo las tortas que vende y así también poder tener los ingresos que necesita. Agradece por esta oportunidad que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Virgen Caacupé committee is in its second cycle of the Women's Committee program. All of them are working hard and learning to work together. They are working to eliminate poverty, and one of them is below the poverty line. 

Aurora is the member who is below the poverty line, but she is fighting tirelessly to be able to grow. She is a person who perseveres and she really wants to get ahead. She makes all kinds of cakes and says she always has good orders and her customers are very happy with her work. Her goal is to keep fighting, since she wants to improve her income and thus help her family. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in buying flour, eggs, butter, sugar and more ingredients to keep making cakes to sell and thus have the income she needs. She is grateful for the opportunity, because it will a big help.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, sugar and more, to make cakes.

loans.name: Apunba Nupi Group

texts.en:
In 2009, these hard working, non-tribal, like-minded women came together to form “Apunba Nupi Lup,” which means United Women. With steady improvement from her previous loans, Memi, the featured borrower with a raised hand, is now living a busy and happy life.

Memi’s main source of income comes from her embroidery work. Initially, she was a weaver, but later on she took up embroidering the woven products from her fellow weavers. With her good handiwork, her work load increased with time. Like every good business, she began to employ three more helpers to meet the customers' needs. At the same time, for better profit opportunities, she also took up embroidery work on mosquito nets, bed sheets and pillow covers. She is very happy with her business, especially the fact that she is in the position to pay her helpers for their work.
 
Now she needs a loan to further improve her business. With this loan she decided to work on home furnishing products like cushion covers and curtains. This loan, in combination with her saved money, will pave the way and contribute towards setting up a small show room in Imphal. She wishes to display her embroidered work on wrap-around skirts, mosquito nets and home furnishing materials. She hopes to establish a big show room for the said items down the road.

Similarly, her fellow members also need and are excited for this Kiva loan. They believe that the loan will to a great extent contribute towards fulfilling their plans with their respective income-generating activities.

loans.use: To expand her business and rent a small showroom in Imphal for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Ariance

texts.en:
Ariance is 46 years old and has seven children. For the past four years, she has been operating a poultry business. Ariance has been able to use her profits to send her children to school and better provide for her family's needs. Last month, she bought five boxes of chicks to raise and sell, but unfortunately, half of them suffered from a virus and died. 

Ariance is requesting a 7,500,000 IDR loan from TLM to purchase five more boxes of chicks and poultry feed. In the future, she hopes to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of chicks and feed

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Juliet has been in this business for seven years now.

Juliet requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and utensils for her business.

In the future, Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.en:
Neichong is pictured with her hand raised and she is the featured profile member of Dorcas group. She lives with her husband and seven children in a village. 

In 2011, she availed a loan from WSDS to start her weaving activities. She weaved traditional shawls and wrap-around skirts for women. In order to supplement the family income she ventured into this activity, which is something she is good at.

Now she needs a loan to do better with her weaving activities. She means to buy yarn for weaving and repair her worn-out handloom to weave. She believes that she can produce more and work faster once her loom is repaired. She can produce at least 15 shawls in a month.

In the future, she plans to establish a small handloom business through purchasing more handlooms and hiring more people to weave. She also hopes to own a cattle farm down the road.

Getting motivated by her, the rest of the group members also need loans to improve upon their activities like poultry, weaving, and vegetable vending.

loans.use: To repair her handloom and also to buy yarn.

loans.name: Saron Group

texts.en: Hekim, who is photographed with her hand raised, is the profiled featured borrower of Saron Group. She lives in a village with her two children and her husband. Initially Hekim owned a small corner shop, where she sold paan, cigarettes and the likes to earn income. She seems to be doing great with her shop business; with steady improvement she expanded to a bigger shop. In order to attract more customers to her shop, she increased her shop items with snacks and essential commodities like cell batteries, candles, toothbrushes, etc. With her good earnings, she has been contributing money towards the children’s education and the family as a whole. She now shares a big role in meeting the family's expenses, and she feels very happy for it. Hekim plans to expand her store still further. She wishes to stock sugar, potatoes, onions, garlic, cooking oil and soap with this loan for higher profits. Until now, she has been operating her store in a rented room. In the near future, she plans to build one of her own. Similarly, the rest of the group members also need loans and want to do better with their businesses like weaving, selling local rice, selling used clothes and selling vegetables. To end with, all the group members feel very fortunate to be receiving a helping hand from all the Kiva lenders and send their good wishes.

loans.use: to buy fresh stock of grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is an adult of 28 years who is married and has two children.

John is an orphan who lost his parents when he was still young. This has made him work hard in his life to make ends meet. As a result, he has been able to start up a small retail shop that earns him income daily and has even bought land on which he has planted bananas. He supplements his income with teaching. 

John has so many orphans to take care of. He pays tuition for his brothers and sisters and also caters for their other needs, and he has a desire to see them finish their educations and become responsible citizens in future, something that makes him work even harder, he says.

This is his second loan. Its purpose is to mulch his banana plantation. John hopes to improve his banana plantation, which will be used for a demonstration farm and as a source of job creation. John's biggest problem, however, is limited capital and price fluctuations that affect his profitability. But with this facility offered to him, he is optimistic that he will solve them and gradually become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To mulch his banana plantation.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 53 years old and she supports four people. For the past 12 years, she has been a small-scale farmer and she earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

Francis is requesting a 100,000 KES loan to purchase farm inputs such as insecticide, fertilizer, and seedlings for the upcoming planting season. She plans to use the income from her loan to buy a dairy cow to diversify her income through dairy farming. In the future, Francis hopes to improve her living standards and become financially stable. She also hopes to save money to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as insecticide, fertilizer, and seedlings

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 52 years old and married with four children. For the past 10 years, she has been a rice farmer in the Philippines. Leonida also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

Leonida is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice seed and pay her farm laborers. She works tirelessly to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice seed and pay her farm laborers

loans.name: Timiditha

texts.en:
