With the received credit, Sulkhan will purchase materials for the greenhouse construction (iron pillars and polyethylene covering) and will then construct the greenhouse, where tomatoes and greens will be grown throughout the year. Sulkhan will work in the greenhouse himself. He will sell the harvested products at the local open market. The income of the family will significantly increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria, una humilde campesina de 55 años, casada, madre de 7 hijos, originaria de León, fue beneficiada con un crédito, le trajo cambios positivo logro comprar insumos necesarios que necesitaba para sembrar yuca vendió su producción, y fue muy buena venta. Ahora desea continuar con uno de sus proyectos el cual es la crianza de cerdos, ella está necesitando el crédito para comprar 4 cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos pues desea lograr tener su crianza de animales y salir adelante para conseguir nuevas formas de ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, a humble farmer of 55 years, is married and has seven children. She is originally from Leon, was the beneficiary of a loan, which brought her positive changes. She was able to purchase items necessary to sow yuca and sold what she produced, and it was a very good sale. Now, she wants to continue with one of her projects which is the raising of pigs. She needs a loan to purchase four pigs and feed to nourish them, since she wants to raise animals to get ahead and create new forms of income to increase her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase 4 pigs and feed to nourish them.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol.

Angelita has been engaged in a rice-farming business together with her husband for more than eight years now. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve their farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Haykavan village of Shirak region. Hovhannes runs a farm. His livestock currently includes two cows, 15 sheep and 32 chickens. He cultivates wheat and potatoes as well as growing apple and pear trees. The farm is the only source of income for him. 

As Hovhannes has insufficient funds to expand his farm, he has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, Hovhannes will purchase seeds and fertilizer. This will enable him to undertake all the necessary work in the cultivation process and gather a good harvest. 

Hovhannes lives with his parents, and it is very important for him to gather a high income and ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife, Sonia, the mother of his three children. Cooperating together, they are capable to cover their expenses, especially their children’s study fees. 

Mohammad owns a grocery store. He sells all kinds of candies, juices, soft drinks and many other products. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase his inventory of these products. In that way, he will be able to diversify his items and therefore, increase his revenues and thus, his way of living. Mohammad looks forward to opening his own supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of candies, juices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Amparo Lineth

texts.es:
Amparo de 58 años de edad, es una mujer que busca como ganarse la vida. Ha trabajado en varios empleos informales, debido a su carencia educativa, su mayor reto ha sido sacar sus hijos adelante, a pesar de las adversidades que ha tenido que enfrentar. Se dedicó a la cría de cerdos, pero la actividad no le generó los ingresos necesarios para subsistir, por lo cual optó con colocar en su vivienda una sala de videojuegos por sugerencia de sus vecinos.
En la actualidad labora con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos, mientras ella se ocupa de los quehaceres del hogar.
Amparo se encuentra satisfecha con la actividad que realiza debido  a que sus ingresos han mejorado, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de tres televisores y tres play station con el fin de ampliar su cobertura y atender a un mayor número de clientes. 
Sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y alcanzar el punto de equilibrio en su negocio.
texts.en:
Amparo is 58 years old, and is a woman that is looking to earn a living. She has worked in various forms of informal employment, on account of a lack of education. Her challenge has been to get her children ahead, in spite of the adversities she has had to face. She worked raising pigs, but the activity didn't generate enough income to live, and so she has decided to turn her house into a gaming hall at the suggestion of her neighbors. Currently, she works with the help of one of three children, while she does the household chores.
Amparo is satisfied with the activity that she is doing, since her income has improved, so now she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of three televisions and three Playstations, with the goal of increasing her capacity and seeing to more clients.
She dreams of increasing the quality of life of her family and reaching the equilibrium point in her business.

loans.use: To purchase three televisions and three playstations for her gaming hall business.

loans.name: Noe Eriberto

texts.es: Noé Eriberto vive junto a s compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Él se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón desde hace aproximadamente veinte años,  tiene mucha experiencia en la venta lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, siempre busca las zonas mas estratégicas para las ventas, es muy conocido en la localidad pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con producto de calidad y a precio accesible además el servicio es excelente; Noé es un hombre dedicado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan concretar su objetivo de llegar al éxito, desde hace algún tiempo la demanda  de su producto ha aumentado al doble y no quiere decepcionarlos por eso ha decidido aumentar la producción e invertir es así como le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de marañón por mayor etc. Noé Eriberto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Noé Eriberto lives with his wife and their two children in their own house. He works selling cashew seeds, and has done so for about 20 years. He has a lot of experience in sales which allows him to obtain a greater income. He works door-to-door and from his home, always looking for more strategic areas to make his sales, and is very well-known in the area since he always has what people need, such as high-quality products at accessible prices, and besides, his service is excellent. Noé is a man who is very dedicated to his labor and who has dreams of getting ahead. He is always looking for new opportunities that will allow him to complete his objective of being successful.

Over a short period of time, the demand for his product has doubled, and since he cannot disappoint his customers, he has decided to increase his production and invest. It is for that reason that he is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase cashew seeds wholesale. Noé Eriberto has good references and is very responsible. He assures us that he will be able to pay the debt and give his family a better life.

loans.use: semilla de marañón por mayor

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from San Miguel, Bohol. Annalie is in the rice-farming business. She helps her husband in tilling their lot.

Annalie is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this loan, Annalie believes that she can improve their farming business and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina earns a living through her sari-sari (or variety) store business. She has been in this venture for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place.

Crispina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap, toiletries and other items. With this loan, she will be be able to cater to and attract more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is a 29-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives alone at a house located in one of the beautiful Lebanese towns. He was working days and nights to be able to manage his expenses and business operations as well. He owns a small mini-market where he sells all kinds of dairy and daily-use products. He also has a coffee machine. He’s well-known for being kind and friendly with his clients. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions. In this way, he will be able to increase his revenues thus improve his way of living. He looks forward to expanding his grocery, and waits for the perfect time to open other branches and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions

loans.name: Ma. Amie

texts.en:
Ma. Amie is 45 years old and married with four children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she is in the business of banana production in the local community. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en: Nesa is 56 years old and married with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Nesa operates a banana production farm in the local community. She has been with her business for over 10 years and earns 7,000 PHP every month. Nesa joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 46 years old and has children she sends to school. She is raising hogs for income. Her spouse is a farmer and a local official. She would like to keep raising healthy hogs; that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 for extra capital to buy feed and medicine for her hogs.

Someday, Marivic hopes to become a successful hog raiser and maintain good income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her hogs

loans.name: Saturai

texts.en:
Saturai is a 40 years old hardworking gentleman. He is married and a father of four children. His wife is a business lady who also brings some additional income to the family. He is a livestock trader in the Narok area and has been running the business for the past four years making a monthly income of KES 25,000

He has borrowed a second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for fattening and to sell at a profit. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His future dream is to build his family a permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to fatten and sell

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela es una joven de 29 años, llena de sueños y con una hija de 6 años de edad que es su mayor motivación para salir adelante. Su condición de madre soltera le ha enseñado a pensar y a vivir la vida de una manera más responsable, entendiendo que su familia es lo más importante y por lo que debe luchar cada día. 
Desde muy joven ha laborado debido a la difícil situación económica de su familia, gracias a esto aprendió de confección y hoy esta actividad le ha dado la oportunidad de generar los recursos para sostener a su hija.
Ángela montó en su casa un pequeño taller, en donde se dedica principalmente a la confección a terceros ya que asegura que es más rentable
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina plana 204, que le permitirá reducir tiempos de producción, generando mejores utilidades que se transformarán en mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela is a young woman of 29 years, full of dreams. She has a daughter 6 years of age who is her greatest motivation to get ahead. Her status as a single mother has taught her to think and to live a life in more responsible manner, understanding that her family is the most important and that for which she should fight every day.
Since she was very young she has worked, due to her family's difficult economic situation. Thanks to this, she learned clothing manufacturing and today this work has given her the opportunity to generate the resources to support her daughter.
Angela set up a small shop in her home, in which she principally manufactures clothing to third parties, as that ensures to be more profitable. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a 204 flat machine, which will allow her to reduce production times, generating more profits which will transform into a greater quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a 204 flat machine

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y  con un excelente servicio; Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Rosa Amelia tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Rosa Amelia lives with her life partner in her own house. She buys and sells fruits and vegetables, strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, and chiles, among others. She has had the business for several years, and this has given her a lot of sales experience that allows her to obtain the best earnings. The location where she sells is very strategic for the activity and is also very busy with people. She already has a lot of customers who prefer her because her product is fresh, well-priced, and of high quality, and there is excellent service. Rosa is an entrepreneurial woman, dedicated to her work and with a lot of desire to move ahead. She is always looking for alternatives that will allow her to achieve success. In the last few weeks demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment, but she does not have sufficient capital to back her in this. That is why she is asking Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables. Rosa Amelia has good payment references. She is thankful for the support and says that she will be able to pay the debt. At the same time she is confident that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn generates income by selling grocery items to the people in her village. Ronalyn is 22 years old, married and has a child. She had been in her business for over a year now and earns 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in selling more merchandise in her store. She will buy sardines, eggs, breads, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell. 

Ronalyn will keep improving the products and services she offers to gain more profits and save for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, breads, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria de 47 años  de edad, originaria de León, casada, madre de 7 hijos, todos mayores de edad, actualmente solo 1 estudia y los demás trabajan, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos de la que es propietaria hace mas  de 10 años,  ella  solo logro finalizar su tercer grado de primaria, debido a las condiciones económica de su familia. Inicio su actividad laboral  con capital propio a la edad de 37 años, pudo comprar poco a poco mas cerdo para aumentar su producción de animales, se vio en la necesidad de buscar mas financiamiento ya que la demanda de la venta de cerdos aumento,  por sus clientes eran cada vez mayor, negocio que le genera ganancias a diarias, ya que cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio.
Maria esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar 10 cerdos, cemolina (alimentos para cerdos) y alambre. Con el objetivo de mantener sus animales en mejores condiciones y construir una galera para que sus cerditos tengan un mejor lugar, ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar más cerdo, ya que de esta manera podrá vender a un mejor precio, para obtener buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old. A native of León, she is married and she has 7 grown-up children: only 1 of them is currently studying, while the others have a job. She is a retailer, having been engaged in buying and selling pigs for 10 years. Due to her family’s economic conditions, she has succeeded in completing third grade of primary school only. She started her activity with her own capital when se was 37, and little by little she has succeeded in buying more pigs to increase her production. She then found herself in need to ask for funding because of an increase in the requests for pig selling as well as in the number of her customers. This is the first job she has had, and through this activity she earns a daily income, and she can count on established customers.
Maria is requesting a loan to buy 10 pigs, semolina (pigs feed) and barbed wire, in order to provide better conditions to her animals and to build a shed to make her pigs live in a better place. She thinks that the loan will help her buying more pigs, and that she will be able to sell them for a better price, thus gaining a better income.

loans.use: To buy 10 pigs, semolina (pigs feed) and barbed wire.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a merchant from Trinidad, Bohol. He engages in the buying and selling of livestock animals like pigs, chickens, and goats.
Marcos needs additional capital to expand his business. He is applying for a loan to buy different kinds of goods and livestock like chickens, goats, and pigs. 
In the future, Marcos hopes to make his business productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy goods and livestock like chickens, goats, and pigs to sell

loans.name: Aroldo Antonio

texts.es:
Aroldo de 51 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Caucasia, Antioquia, Colombia, en donde labora comercializando sandia por unidades. Esta actividad se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus hijos. Todos los días debe levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana a comenzar su faena. Se dirige a la plaza de mercado en donde realiza la compra del producto al por mayor con el propósito de generar ganancias a escala. Posteriormente, se ubica en un pequeño espacio del parque principal en donde distribuye su producto.

Su mayor sueño es poder generar los recursos necesarios para establecer su negocio en un punto estratégico del municipio y posicionarlo en el mercado, con el fin de generar mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar la condición de vida en su hogar.  Estas son las razones que motivan a Aroldo a solicitar un crédito e invertir en la compra de sandia.
texts.en:
51 year old Aroldo lives in the town of Caucasia, Antioquia, Colombia, where he works selling watermelon by the unit. This work has become his only source of profits for the sustenance  of his family, composed of his spouse and his children. Each day, he gets up at four in the morning to start his job. He goes to the marketplace where he purchases the product in bulk, for the purpose of generating profits to scale. Later he is located in a small space of the main park, where he distributes his product. 
His greatest dream is to be able to generate the necessary resources to establish his business in a strategic location of the town, and position it in the marketplace with the goal of generating better profits, which allow him to improve the condition of life in his household. These are the reasons which motivate Aroldo to request a loan and to invest in the purchase of watermelon.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon.

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Freddy, Luchador y trabajador, habita en el municipio de la Concepcion en el Barrio San Caralampio junto a sa familia su mayor sueño es mejorar de condiciones, actualmente el es comerciante de Frutas y Verduras desde hace 3 años con este financiamiento comprara Frutas y verduras para aumentar su Inventario y obtener asi mejores ingresos, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado al otorgarle este credito
texts.en: Young Freddy, fighter and hardworker, lives the town of Concepcion in the San Caralampio neighborhood with his family. His greatest dream is to improve conditions. Nowadays, he sells fruits and vegetables. He has done this for 3 years. With this loan, he will purchase fruits and vegetables to increase his inventory and thus earn better profits. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and the Kiva loans have offered in granting him this loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic needs products wholesale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a 39-year-old married woman with eight children. She sells dried fish to earn a living. She used to sell second-hand clothes. Hadija has been operating her fish-selling business for more than ten years. With the income from her business, she has managed to educate four of her children and the other four are still in school.
Hadija wants to grow her business so that it generates more income. She needs 20,857 KES to buy a refrigerator to preserve her fish.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to preserve her fish.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and only one child who is still studying. He collaborates with his wife in order to pay their child’s study costs. His wife teaches at a local school. As for him, he has owned a sweet factory since 1992. In parallel, he has a small grocery store. 

Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of raw materials such as sugar, flour and many other items. He notes that this will enhance his work and allow him to produce sweets in a bigger quantity. In the future, he plans to open his own pastry operation.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of raw materials such as sugar, flour and many other items.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 50 years old, married and had three children. She operates a retail store to gain income. She had been in the business for two years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell and meet her customers' needs. Out of her loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she will buy coffee, sugar, sardines and breads to sell. 

Though she only acquires minimal income from the business, she manages it well and hopes to achieve good profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, sardines and breads to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia de 43 años, originaria de León, soltera, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 12, 16 y 22 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, frijoles, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 16 años, solo logro finalizar su segundo año de secundaria. Ella dice que inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 26 años, la cual se vio en la necesidad de generar ingresos por si misma para  poder mantener a sus hijos y darles una mejor  educación para que sean unas personas profesionales y tengan mejores oportunidad de trabajo,  se siente muy  orgullosa de seguir luchando cada día por el bienestar de su familia, y a la misma vez obtener mejores ganancias. Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio.
Claudia esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar 10 quintales de maíz, 3 quintales de frijoles y leña. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima por mayor que necesita para la elaboración de sus tortillas, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder ser una gran empresaria, con el objetivo de darles empleos a las personas, sus metas próxima es que sus hijos logro coronar su carrera universitaria
texts.en:
Claudia is 43 years old. A native of León, she is a single mother of 3 children aged 12, 16 and 22. She is a retailer, and she has been engaged in selling tortillas and beans for more than 16 years; she has succeeded in studying up to the second year of secondary school only. She says that she started working as a retailer when she was 26, as she found herself in need of earning an income for herself as well as to succeed in providing for her children, granting them a better education in order to make them become professionals and find better working opportunities. She is very proud of continuing working hard in a daily basis for the wellbeing of her family, earning a better income at the same time. Her wish is to make her activity grow.
Claudia is requesting a loan to buy 10 quintals of corn, 3 quintals of beans and firewood. She thinks that the loan will help her buying at wholesale price all the basics ingredients she needs to prepare her tortillas. Her future plans include becoming a great entrepreneur, and to create jobs. Her goal for the future is that her children succeed in completing their university studies.

loans.use: To buy 10 quintals of corn, 3 quintals of beans and firewood.

loans.name: Genadi

texts.en:
Genadi is 37 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and three children in Kobuleti District. His mother is provided with a retirement pension and his son goes to school. Genadi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Genadi has a car and works as a taxi driver. He serves local people and earns income. It makes a total of 500 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Genadi has decided to change his taxi's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. It will allow him to decrease the price of the service, which will attract many customers. Increasing the number of customers and cutting his costs will positively affect his profit. He will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. The increased income will be used for the family's wellbeing. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to pay for a fuel system change for his taxi.

loans.name: Lucila Migdalia

texts.es:
Lucila, 49 años de edad, originaria de Mal pasillo, en las afueras de León, madre de 3 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de cafetín, de la que es propietaria hace 1 año, con conocimiento académico de  tercer año de secundaria. Inicio en su actividad a la edad de 47 años con pequeños préstamos que hizo a las instituciones, debido a que necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y generar ingresos por si misma, ya que miro que era una zona muy buena para el sector comercio, porque se vende bastante,  ella se siente muy satisfecha porque a diarios obtiene ganancias, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo y una empleada, sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio y poder mantenerlo estable y rentable.
En esta ocasión ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar gaseosa, agua embotellada, jugo, pollo, carnes, arroz y frijoles, con el propósito de agregar mas producto a inventario y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, al venderle la mercadería mas solicitada, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder tener una cuenta de ahorro para casos de emergencia, sus metas próxima es pagar este crédito, para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Lucila is 49 years old. A native of Mal Pasillo, a suburb of the town of León, she is the mother of 3 grown-up children. She is a retailer and she has been running a small café for 1 year; she has succeeded in studying up to the third years of secondary school. She started her activity when she was 47 thank to small loans from various institutions, as she needed a way to survive and to earn a living for herself, and she saw that hers was a very good area to start a retailing activity as sales were quite satisfactory. She fells deeply satisfied because she earns an income on a daily basis. Her husband and an employee help her running her activity. She wishes that her activity keeps on growing and to succeed in keeping it established and lucrative.
In this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy fizzy drinks, bottled water, juices, chicken, meat, rice and beans in order to stuck up her inventory with more products, thus succeeding in satisfying her customers’ needs by selling them the products they need the most. In the future she plans on having an account for her savings to be used for emergencies, while her future goal is to repay this loan to then request a new one.

loans.use: To buy fizzy drinks, bottled water, juices, chicken, meat, rice and beans.

loans.name: Sonko Suwa Warmisita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SONKO SUWA WARMISITA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos de linaza, pintura de madera, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, elaboración de joyas, costura de chamarras, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, pero al inicio del negocio ofrecía desayunos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta los préstamos y el apoyo en salud.

Aeste grupo le acompaña su asesora de crédito Francisca, que se encuentra centada con una chamarra verde.
texts.en:
The "Sonko Suwa Warmisita" group is starting its first loan with "Pro Mujer" (For Women) as a part of the "Centro Focal de Panamericana" communal bank.  It is made up of 9 members and is directed by a board of directors, where Modesta is the president.  The businesses that the group members are a part of are varied and include activities such as selling linaza juice (a local fruit), wood finishing, running a convenience store, selling food, jewel crafting, knitting sweaters, and knitting backpacks.

The loan that they will take out will help small businesses that Modesta is a part of.  She comments that this is the first loan that she is making with Pro Mujer.  She is making it due to an invitation from a promoter of the institution that went to visit her at her house.  Currently, she runs a convenience store.  She started this business several years ago, but at first her business only sold breakfast foods.

The loan that she is getting is to increase her capital (buy rice, oil, and noodles) that she will get from the markets in the city of La Paz.  The goods she buys will then be sold at her place of business.  This form of work allows her to generate income to sustain her house (she is married and has a son).

When asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans and the health support.

This group is accompanied by their credit consultant, Francisca, who is pictured in the green sweater.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Tovmas

texts.en:
Tovmas is a young farmer from Horom village of Shirak region. He owns agricultural land where he cultivates potatoes. He sells the harvest in the local markets and gets income that helps him to sustain his family.

Tovmas is 29 years old and lives with his parents, sister and wife. He works hard to cover the family's basic costs and give his family appropriate living conditions.

As Hovhannes has insufficient funds to purchase fertilizer, he has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, he will purchase fertilizer and will be able to undertake all the necessary cultivation processes. 

Hovhannes hopes that the loan will give him an opportunity to gather a good harvest and high income. He waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 35 years old and lives in Gori with her husband and two children (5 and 9 years old). Khatuna’s husband is a workman and Khatuna is a masseuse. She serves her clients in their house. Both family members get a small monthly salary. 

Khatuna requested a loan from local financial institutions to start a massage room and expand her business, but without success. Her loan request was rejected because of her low income and insufficient experience in her business. However, her loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The program provides start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. These people do not have access to traditional credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Khatuna requested a loan to start a massage room in a beauty center. She plans to purchase the essential equipment needed to satisfy the needs of a professional masseuse. Khatuna will serve her clients in the room and  this will raise the income of the family, which she will use to improve the family’s living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a massage room.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena lives in the town of Sisian with her husband and son. She runs a farm that includes 3 cows, 4 chickens, and cultivates wheat. Lena gets milk, which she uses in cheese production. Due to her hard work, the cheese is in demand among the buyers. Agriculture helps Lena to have stable income during the month so she would like to expand her farm.
 
Lena has applied for this loan to purchase 5 pigs, 10 sheep, and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Lena to expand her farm and gather more income.

With this loan,  Lena will be able to ensure a better life for her son and husband.

loans.use: to pay for 5 pigs, 10 sheep and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 29 years old. He lives in the Telavi district of Georgia with his wife and 4-year-old daughter. 

Shota has unsuccessfully requested loans from local financial institutions several times to fund the start-up of his family business. His loan requests were rejected because of his family's low income and poor living conditions. The sources of income for Shota's family are the seasonal income from selling harvested maize grown on the family-owned land. Besides the maize, he raises three pigs and sells piglets. 

The income totals 100 laris per month and is hardly enough to provide food for a family of three. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Shota requested a loan from Credo to restart his family business, which was stopped because of financial problems. His loan request was approved by a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are often regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Shota will purchase a truck to transport wood from the forest. The wood will be sold in his village and in nearby villages. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to transport wood from the forest.

loans.name: Margarita Reina

texts.es: Margarita Reina vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de comida desayunos y almuerzos como tamales, huevos, frijoles, sopas, carnes, ensaladas entre otros; tiene varios años con el negocio y  eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias además le da la oportunidad q cada dia mejores sus platillos; comercia en un lugar que califico como muy bueno para sus actividades y es muy conocida por todas las personas de la comunidad pues prepara las comidas mas deliciosas de la zona, ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a buen precio y sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Margarita es una mujer activa, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y siempre dispuesta a luchar por encontrar las mejores alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así cumplirá su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, pollos, verduras, carne, huevos, bebidas, etc. Margarita Reina tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Margarita Reina lives with her life partner and their children. She engages in selling meal, breakfasts and snacks such as tamales, eggs, beans, soups, meat and salads. She has been engaged in this activity for a few years, and she has gained a great experience in selling that allows her to earn a better income as well as to improve her dishes every day. She works in a locale she described as very goof for her activity, and she is well-known by all the members of her community because she prepare the most delicious food in the area. She already has established customers who chose her because of the high quality of everything she sells, she has good prices and on top of this she provides an excellent service. Margarita is an active and resourceful woman who is engaged in her activity and who is always ready to work hard to find the best chances to succeeds. Her greatest secret is the effort and love she works with, as she know that this is the only way to reach her goal. In the past few weeks there has been an increase in her requests and she wants to take advantage of this to invest once again in her activity. As she needs working capital to do this she has asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will help her buying corn, chicken, vegetables, meat, eggs and soft drinks. Margarita Reina can count on good repayment references and she is very responsible. She guarantees she will be able to repay her dues, and the same time she is sure she will provide her family with a satisfactory life.

loans.use: To corn, chicken, vegetables, meat, eggs and soft drinks.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a 29-year-old father of 4 children. He runs a farm, which currently includes 6 cows, 22 sheep, 3 pigs and 20 chickens. Armen also owns a plot of agricultural land where he cultivates potatoes.

He works hard to sustain his family and cover his children's daily costs. As agriculture is the only source of income for Armen, he would like expand it.
He has applied for this loan to purchase 3 cows. This will enable him to gather more milk and milk products to sell in the local markets. 

The loan is very important for Armen to gather more income and ensure a better life for his lovely family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows.

loans.name: Touch Me Group

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Patricia from Mutare. She is married with four children; three of her children are attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Patricia runs a retail business selling electrical appliances. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are credit sales as debtors sometimes fail to pay on time. 

Patricia has requested a loan of $600 to buy more stock of electrical appliances for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her disposable income. 

In the future, Patricia plans to open a shop in the central business district of Mutare.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 24 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a barbershop since 2011 and has three years of experience.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy some furniture and an air conditioner for the salon. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income.

loans.use: to buy some furniture and an air conditioner for the salon.

loans.name: Dora Elvia

texts.es:
Dora de 46 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y guerrera, toda su vida se ha dedicado a las labores del hogar y a velar por el bienestar de sus tres hijos. Desde hace 3 meses montó una legumbrería con el propósito de generar ingresos para su hogar ya que la condición económica que padecen en la actualidad es incierta debido a que su cónyuge se encuentra sin empleo.

Su mayor sueño es surtir la legumbrería y ampliar el portafolio de servicios con productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejor calidad en el servicio, generando un mayor volumen de ventas. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de legumbre, gaseosa y mecatos. Espera que su negocio le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, estabilizar la crisis financiera por la que atraviesan y garantizarle a su hijo menor acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Dora is a 46 years old woman with the spirit of an entrepreneur and a fighter. All her life she has worked to take care of her home and ensure the well-being her three children. Three months ago she started a vegetable stand in order to generate more income for her household as her economic condition is currently poor and uncertain due to the fact that her spouse is unemployed at present. 

Her primary goal is to stock the vegetable stand and expand the range of products and services she provides for the standard family basket of goods in order to offer her customers better quality and service. This way she will generate a higher volume of sales. For this reason she is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase vegetables, soft drinks, and pastries. She hopes her business will allow her to improve the quality of life in her home, stabilize the financial crisis her family currently faces, and guarantee her youngest child access to higher education.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, soft drinks, and pastries

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Ms Basheeran is 41-years-old, an energetic married woman and a mother of eight children, five of which are attending school. For the last three years, she has been in business manufacturing a ‘waan’ (which is a material used in making charpoy [a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan]). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she has become famous for providing good quality waan in her community.
 In this way Basheeran is able to manage the needs of her family members. Her husband and a son are employed in a weaving factory but their income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She needs to improve her business and to do so she applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistan Rupee) to buy another waan making machine for her son to assist her in his free time. Basheeran's dream is to use part of her profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy another waan making machine.

loans.name: Inayat

texts.en:
Ms. Inayat is a 47-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past eight years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Inayat's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of six children and wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of 20,000 Rs (Pakistan rupees) to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Astrid Yanet

texts.es:
Astrid de 22 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 3 años. Por el cual lucha a fin de garantizarle un mejor futuro. Desde hace dos años se dedica a la elaboración de bordados con el fin colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Esta actividad le ha permitido ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y asegurarle una educación a su hijo. 
Astrid se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará un pirograbador y pinturas para la elaboración de sus productos, 
Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar, espera incrementar sus ventas y cubrir las necesidades básicas debido a la inestabilidad el trabajo de su cónyuge. 
Su mayor sueño es abrir un local con sus productos y convertirse en una microempresaria.
texts.en:
Astrid is 22 years old and is the mother a three year old son. She works hard to guarantee him a better future. For two years she has worked doing embroidery in order to help her husband with household expenses. This work has allowed her offer her family a better quality of life and ensure a good education for her son. 

Astrid is requesting a loan in order to purchase a pyrography or wood burning kit to help her with the completion of her products. She hopes to begin increasing her sales in order to improve the living conditions in her home and cover the basic necessities given the instability of her husband's work. Her biggest dream is to one day open her own shop for her goods and become a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase a pyrography kit and paints.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 44-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She has been in a tailoring business for the last six years. Her husband is a laborer, and his income is not sufficient to cover their daily expenditures. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well.

Ms. Naseem has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees to expand her business further, and her case has been approved by Kashf Foundation. She is going to use her loan to purchase a new stitching machine and materials like stock of thread of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to increase her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and materials like stock of thread of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Walait

texts.en:
Ms. Walait is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 4 children, two daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing and health. Her husband is employed in a small job but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family.

She did not lose hope and started her own business of cloth trading to contribute to the family income. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She purchases cloth in bulk from different markets and sells them in her community. She is famous for selling good quality cloth in her community.

She is in her 3rd loan cycle and requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers.  She expects a boost in her earnings through her large sales.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Ms. Mussarat is 46 years old and is a dedicated mother of four children. She is efficiently doing a business of milk sales and has gained years of experience in this field. She has three buffaloes to milk and sells their milk to the people of her community. She also purchases small calves and sells them near the Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan) and earns a good profit from this business. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her three children to school for an education. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to purchase another buffalo to milk to get an increase in production capacity of milk. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo in milk to get increase in production capacity of milk.

loans.name: Jancy Cecilia

texts.es: Jancy Cecilia es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos, camarón, pescado, cangrejo entre otros,  tiene varios años laborando lo que le ha dado experiencia en las ventas convirtiéndose asi en uno de las mejores, obteniendo excelentes  ganancias, trabajo de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas de la localidad; Jancy es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus metas, lo mas impórtate en su vida es su pequeña familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de su hogar, la casa necesita modificaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad de todos, es una mujer comprometida y no duda que podrá realizar los cambios lo mas pronto posible obteniendo el éxito deseado, necesita invertir para el techo y el piso de la vivienda pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, piso, herramientas, duralita etc. Jancy Cecilia tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, esta agradecido con la ayuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jancy Cecilia is a single mother who lives together with her child. She works selling shellfish, shrimp, fish, and crab, among other items. She has worked for various years and has the sales experience necessary in one of the best in the business, making good profits. She works as traveling saleswoman in different districts throughout the area. Jancy is a woman devoted to her work, willing to give everything she has to achieve her goals. The most important thing in her life is her small family and in recent weeks the deterioration of their home has disrupted the tranquility of the household. The house needs repairs and she hopes to complete these as soon as possible for the security of everyone involved. Jancy is a dedicated woman and has no doubts that she will be able to complete the changes as quickly as possible and obtain the desired results. She will invest in the roof and the floor of her home, but she does not have the necessary funds. For this reason she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow her to purchase cement, bricks, flooring, tools, and insulation, etc. Jancy Cecilia has strong payment references and takes responsibility for the paying her debts. She is grateful for the assistance and hopes to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: cement, bricks, flooring, tools, and insulation.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has gained five years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi is married with one child. He lives in Ahnidzor village in the Lori region and has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years. He keeps livestock which currently includes 8 cows, 42 pigs, 10 chickens and 110 colonies of bees. Arkadi runs his farm with great love and pleasure and works hard to gather good income and sustain his family.

Arkadi is mainly concentrated on beekeeping. Due to his hard work, he gets high quality honey which is very demanded by the buyers. Now Arkadi needs financial support to purchase 30 colonies of bees to meet clients' demand. He has applied for this loan to purchase 30 colonies of bees. The loan is very important for Arkadi to expand his agricultural activity and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 30 colonies of bees

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Ms. Hanifan is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. For the past 3 years, she has been successfully running a milk shop where she sells milk and yogurt to the people of her community. Over time she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

Her husband and one son are employed in a textile mill but their income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation to purchase milk in large quantities with some utensils such as bowls and bottles to cater to more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk in large quantities with some utensils such as bowls and bottles to cater to more customers time after time

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms Nazia is a 35-year-old married woman and has been in the business of sewing for nine years to help her husband. Her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the family expenses with the educational needs of their children. This is why she started sewing at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. 
At this time, Nazia is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistan Rupees) to purchase more spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet with increasing demand from her regular customers: her neighbors and the local community. Nazia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms Shamim is a 46-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of selling milk for the last six years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread winner. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has three buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 
Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistan Rupees) to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es: Josefa Antonia vive junto a su compañero de vida Miguel y sus hijos, ella posee un molino de nixtamal, es muy conocida y tiene mas de trece años con el negocio, eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en el servicio que le  permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, es muy solicitada en la localidad la gente la recomienda porque su molino tiene precios accesibles, con maquinas de calidad y un servicio excelente; Josefa  es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy motivada a salir adelante, le gusta luchar por sus sueños sabe que si se esfuerza al máximo lograra lo que se propone y tendrá mucho éxito en su vida. Como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y reparar algunas maquinas con desperfectos por lo que desea realizar una nueva inversión y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar repuestos, herramientas, aceite etc. Josefa Antonia tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Josefa Antonia lives with Miguel, her life's companion, and their children. She has a nixtamal mill. She is very well known and and has had her business for more than thirteen years. This has given her a lot of experience in this type of service and this has allowed her to earn more income. She is very much in demand in the area and people recommend her because her mill has accessible prices with quality machines and excellent service. Josefa is a woman who is dedicated to her work, energetic and very motivated to get ahead. She likes to fight for her dreams because she knows if she works as hard as she can she will be very successful in life. Like any good merchant, she wants to grow the business and repair some machines that have problems. That is why she wants to make a new investment and is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy replacement parts, tools, oil, etc. Josefa Antonia has good payment references and impeccable morals. She is sure that she can pay off her debt and she is sure she can bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts, tools and oil.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Jargal is 41 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in an apartment in Hovd Province, Mongolia.  Her husband, Monhbaatar, is a driver who provides transportation services in the inner city. Her 20-year-old daughter, Enhzaya, is a university student.  

Mrs. Jargal has been running her clothing sales business in the local market since 2006.  She has started her organic cashmere and woolen products sales in a rental counter of the local market in 2012.  Her husband purchases organic woolen and cashmere products from capital city and she sells them to the local customers. 

She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large inventory of organic woolen and cashmere products.  She is a hardworking, positive, and modest woman who says "We need to get our daughter highly educated and be able to live her own in future."

loans.use: to purchase organic woolen and cashmere products.

loans.name: Bushran

texts.en:
Ms Bushran is 44 years old and married. She has been running a business of hand-embroidery for the last two years. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She is a mother of 5 children and wants to grow her business. 
Bushran requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan Rupees) to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet her increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business and also earn money for themselves. Bushran is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Ms. Asma is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years. She started this line of work at a very young age. Today she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.  

In order to meet with the increasing demand of her customers, she needs to purchase more spools of threads with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material of better quality. For this reason, she requested a loan of 15,000 Rs (Pakistan rupees) from Kashf Foundation. It would help her to complete the orders of her customers on time, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material of better quality.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Ms. Musarat is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of flower manufacturing for many years. She offers various handmade artificial flowers in different colors which are used in decorating homes and rooms. Over time she has become famous for providing good quality colorful flowers in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. 

Musarat has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her eighth loan cycle and applied for a loan of 30,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees). This will help her to purchase raw material, including various types of fabrics such as silk and cotton in various colors, and packs of glues and wires. In this way, she would be able to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw material, including various types of fabrics such as silk and cotton in various colors, and packs of glues and wires.
